dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thick morning fog blankets all. A faint glow in the East. It’s quiet save for the DISTANT RUMBLE of artillery. Super title: Somewhere in Nazi Germany... A Spanish Arabian STALLION emerges from the fog. A wasp waisted German Army LIEUTENANT erect in its saddle. His disciplined horse elegantly picks its way over the furrow soil. A dark hulk looms in the mist -- Horse and rider approach... IT’S A BURNED OUT TANK -- An American Sherman. Still smoldering. Steel armor ripped open like tin foil. The Lieutenant moves on. Encounters another charred tank. entire turret blown off. A small fire still burns inside. Around it are the blackened twisted shapes of burnt shrun men. He moves on. Another hulk emerges from the mist -- This t looks like a scrap heap -- Sandbags, railroad ties, slopp steel plate, cases of wine, rations and ammunition. Batte scarred and seemingly abandoned. The Lieutenant guides his horse in a slow circle around t armored vehicle. He HEARS a faint CLINK -- And draws his Luger from its shiny black holster -- THEN: An AMERICAN SOLDIER hiding BEHIND THE TURRET leaps on him Tearing the German from his horse. The two men CRASH to t ground. The American stabs the Lieutenant in the face -- THWICK-THWICK-THWICK! Fast, violent, shocking... The American then carefully slides the knife blade behind German’s eye - Piercing his brainpan with a CRACK. The Ge convulses for a moment. And dies... The American retrieves his knife. Wipes it clean on the German’s uniform and scans the area with burning primal e This is DON “WARDADDY” COLLIER. Late twenties he looks mi aged. A light beard and hollow cheeks. Years of combat ha ground him into something hard and sharp. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With the mechanical clumsiness of exhaustion, Wardaddy cu the map case from the German’s belt. Then rips the large Knight’s Cross medal from the dead man’s neck. Wardaddy stands to his full impressive height in his oil blackened overalls. He crosses to the horse. He grabs the beautiful animal’s bridal and looks at it for a moment... Eye to eye. Connection with the animal. With incredible gentleness he rubs its muzzle. And kisses it... Then he pulls his knife -- The horse jerks back, but Ward holds it firm. He knows horses... THWICK! - He cuts off the bridle, slips the bit from its mouth. He unbuckles the saddle and drops it to the soil. Wardaddy looking at the horse. Then it heads back the way came - Now without ride and tack. Wardaddy climbs aboard his tank -- Her name is “FURY” -- painted on her cannon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Cramped. Crowded. A filthy machine with filthy men. There’s two main areas - THE TURRET BASKET -- A big cylindrical cage that spins with the turret. And the BOW -- The front of the tank where the driver and machine gunner sit. The sound of piss hitting tin... BOYD “BIBLE” SWAN is draped casually across the cannon breech. A pastor’s kid from Des Moines, he’s serious, cal centered. You’d never guess he’s killed a thousand men. H finishes urinating into an ammo can. TRINI “GORDO” GARCIA sits in the driver’s seat sipping wi from a bottle. A Mexican butcher from Chicago. He’s been drunk since 1942. He once went into combat sober - And vo never to do it again. Next to Gordo, the transmission housing between them, is body of RED. A blood soaked jacket pulled over his head. blood spattered inside the tank. GRADY “COON-ASS” TRAVIS, a good-old-boy from Arkansas, is wedged into the battery compartment fixing a short. He’s cunning, viscous and World wise. Wardaddy drops down into the Commander’s hatch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Get that fucker?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I knocked him off. Gordo offers Red a drink, pushes the bottle into his shoulder. Whispers to him...

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Gordo. Stop. Leave him rest.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: He’s dead. Or did you forget? Drunk damn fool. Gordo shoots them a dirty look. Keeps whispering to his d friend. Wardaddy watches Coon-Ass work.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddammit. Ain’t you done?

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Keep ridin’ me.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I’m not riding you. If I was, you’d know it. More where he came from. Wardaddy tosses Bible the Knight’s Cross - Bible hangs it the turret - Where more German combat decorations hang li Christmas ornaments.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You get some canned bacon for this? He tosses Gordo the dead Officer’s Luger. He inspects it.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: For this? Yeah. A case or two. Wardaddy lights a cigarette. Then scratches another notch his knife with his GI can opener. It’s tense - They are behind German lines and acutely aware of the danger they’ in. But danger becomes routine. After years of it... Coon-Ass smirks - KNOWING he’ll get a rise...

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: How come you didn’t shoot that horse? You love shooting horses so much. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy darkens with outrage -- He works his way over to Coon-Ass and begins kicking the hell out of him. COON-ASS (CONT’D) Stop it! What’s that for?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: You know what it’s for.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Why you always whoopin’ on me?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Because you’re an animal. A dog. All you understand is the fist and boot.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Bull-sheeet. I understand me the pussy and the gun. Killin’ and fuckin’.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: In that order?

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Maybe. Timing’s important. I like me warm pussy. Pipin’ hot.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: You still talking? Can we get out of here? Everyone shut up.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: You shut up. You’re a goddamn bottle of wine. Stink like wine. Think like wine. Alcohol never solved nothing.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Neither did milk. Let’s go. Vamanos. Vamanos ya.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Wanna talk Mexican? Find another tank. A Mexican tank. This is an American tank. We talk American.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Who put a nickel in you? You talk Kraut. You can talk German and I can’t talk Spanish? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I use my German as a tool of war. Coon-Ass grabs his crotch...

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Here’s my tool of war. Bible realizes this isn’t about horses or Spanish. It’s a Red -- The man with his head blown off in the Bow Gunner' seat. Bible hands Wardaddy some coffee he warmed on a Col stove.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Thanks Boyd.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Stop ragging on everyone. You didn’t kill Red. The German's did.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: That’s true. But I sure didn’t keep him alive.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: His number came up. That’s all. We've been lucky. Until now. Settle down. Wardaddy adds sugar to his coffee. Stirs it with a greasy callused finger. He opens the German’s mapcase -- Discove several maps...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Thank heavens. We got a map. Wardaddy studies a German map...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're here. Battalion Area’s to the South. This hardball road here’11l get us back. Sound good?

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: You got the stripes, Daddy. You figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I got more, boy. Need more? Wardaddy pokes his head out of the Commander’s hatch and listens carefully to the coming dawn. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His finely tuned instincts kick in. Wardaddy drops back inside - Pulls the hatch shut with a CLANK...

dialogues.speaker: THEN
dialogues.text: The sound of ROARING LOCOMOTIVES -- An Artillery barrage on the way... BOOM-BOOM-KABOOM! -- Shells explode around the tank. Rock it. For the moment the men are safe in their steel cocoon

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Coon-Ass? Anytime, sweetheart. Coon-Ass turns a last bolt then extricates himself from t batteries.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: ‘Kay. Crank her up, Gordo. Whip this bitch like your donkey back in Old Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: I'll whip your Alabama ass with my donkey cock. Gordo pushes the starter button. Expectant faces. The eng RUMBLES but doesn’t catch. MORE EXPLODING SHELLS -- Incredibly loud. Shrapnel PINGS the hull. They endure it with their trademark stoicism. They've been through it before - But a direct hit can kil them...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Choke’er up. She’s cold. Gordo opens the choke. Tries again. The engine rumbling. Doesn’t start. Worried faces.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: There’s condensation on the plugs.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Plugs’re good. Don’t flood it.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Drunk or not I can start a damn tank. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: VROOM! -- The engine ROARS to life. They are relieved. Lo key and businesslike, they don their headsets - It’s now unbelievably loud in the tank. Coon-Ass joins Wardaddy an Bible in the turret basket.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Move out! Gordo double-clutches and shifts into first. The tank lurches. Bible presses his eye to the gunsight... Wardaddy rotates the turret with his THUMBSWITCH, looking outside through a PERISCOPE. BEHIND GORDO -- We see the turret basket rotating, the le of Wardaddy, Bible and Coon-Ass standing inside - It’s an impressive sight...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forward! Pick it up! Forward! The tank RATTLES. CLANKS and SHUDDERS. Ammo cases, weapon rations vibrate. We are in the belly of the beast. KABOOM-BOOM-BOOM! -- Shells explode dangerously close. Th tank shudders. Gordo clutches, shifts into second. Stomps gas. The tank builds speed. Wardaddy SEES the road...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Drive! Left. Left. Left. ON GORDO - Turning the tank with the two big steering lev He whips it onto the road, upshifts into third gear. The builds speed - Moving surprisingly fast. Gordo can sure drive a tank. Eyes riveted to his periscop Gas, oil, blood and piss sloshing over his boots. Red’s b in the seat next to him. Leaving the CRASHING artillery behind... Out of immediate danger, Wardaddy opens his hatch and tak his normal position - Exposed from the chest up in the commander's hatch. He grips a captured German assault rif grimly scanning for threats with his cold hard eyes. The Fury has escaped. Her crew is neither grateful or relieved. There is work to do. The war is not over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A farmer's field has been overrun by a travelling circus death - An American Armored Battalion. A couple thousand A couple hundred vehicles. The TIRED MEN load TIRED VEHIC for another day on the attack. Months of spearheading int Germany have taken their toll. A BOOMING ARTILLERY BATTERY pumps rounds into German targ miles away. The BLACK DRIVERS of the Redball Express Truc unload heaps of supplies from their trucks. MECHANICS, CLERKS, COOKS and MPs move with purpose. INFANTRYMEN clean weapons. A CHAPLAIN gives last rites outside the surgery tent as MEDICS line up more litters o WOUNDED MEN. A hundred GERMAN PRISONERS sit listlessly behind barbed w A BULLDOZER plows a heap of dead Germans into a pit. A ROW OF FIFTEEN SHERMAN TANKS -- Their busy CREWS ready for another day’s push into Germany. The tankers stop wor and stare in amazement. HERE COMES THE FURY -- Driving up fast, it deftly spins a parks perfectly alongside the newer, cleaner tanks. SERGE DAVIS, commander of the Lucy Sue shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Thought you were dead Collier.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: The Devil watches over his own. Wardaddy jumps down. A pair of MEDICS approach the tank w a litter. Wardaddy and Gordo haul Red’s corpse out of the tank and lay him onto the litter.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take care of him. He was a good man. The Medic SEES the top of Red’s head is gone.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: You said you had wounded. We’re not graves registration.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Take good care of him. Or I’1l take good care of you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wardaddy pats his assault rifle with menace. The Medics t looks and depart with the body. Gordo crawls under the ta and passes out in the mud. LIEUTENANT PARKER approaches Wardaddy. Young and fresh, h has just a month with the outfit. He’s intimidated by Wardaddy, this tough tanker hard tempered by war’s hammer

dialogues.speaker: LT. PARKER
dialogues.text: Sergeant I was afraid you were dead. I’m awful sorry about T-5 Conley.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: It’s Red. We call him Red.

dialogues.speaker: LT. PARKER
dialogues.text: Sure. Where’s the rest of Third Platoon?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: We're it.

dialogues.speaker: LT. PARKER
dialogues.text: What happened out there?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Another goddamned green Lieutenant happened.

dialogues.speaker: LT. PARKER
dialogues.text: What do I tell the Captain?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Tell him we drove straight into a strongpoint. Two Kraut tanks were dug in like pillboxes. I got ‘em both. After they got everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: LT. PARKER
dialogues.text: We’re moving again. Headquarters section’s already folding. You’re in my Platoon now. We’re assigned to check out a town while main unit bypasses.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: A goddamned flank guard mission? Wardaddy nods at the Fury. Looking even more ragged in th daylight. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, I gotta short in the master switch box. Steering linkage is rattling. Engine’s losing compression. Oil’s in the radiator. Bogies need rubber. There’s a 75 gouge on the turret that’1ll take twenty pounds of welding rod to fill in. She’s a mess. So’s my crew.

dialogues.speaker: LT. PARKER
dialogues.text: Make ready to depart the company area on my order.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Yessir. Fuck my life. The young officer spins on his heels and walks off. Warda looks at Bible and Coon-Ass, staring at him from atop the tank. Just crushed. Beaten, exhausted. Spent.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Parker’s douchebag. We working for that Yankee fool now?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Don’t you worry about him. You work for me. Restock ammo and rations. Wake up Gordo. Have him top off the water and gas. Do what you can about the mechanical issues. Wardaddy walking away.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: The latrine to take a shit. I ain’t shit in a week. NORMAN ELLISON a shiny new Private with a dufflebag intercepts Wardaddy.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Sergeant Collier?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Maybe. What the fuck are you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ll.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Private Ellison. I was told to report to you. I’m your new Assistant Driver.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Lookit you. Crisp and green like a new dollar bill. Puppy breath and all. Wardaddy lights a smoke. An outgoing volley from the near Artillery Company makes Norman flinch.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about outgoing. Incoming mail’s the issue. Nazis can drop an 88 shell in your hip pocket from two miles out. Wardaddy directs him to the Fury.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s home. Do what you’re told. And don’t get too close to no one. Wardaddy walks off. Norman approaches the tank. Bible and Coon-Ass scrutinize the newcomer. Gordo slides out from u the hull, bathed in mud. The three feral tankers eye Norm Gordo grabs Norman's dufflebag and searches it. Norman af to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Which way’s the front? Bible gestures in a wide circle.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: All around us. Kid, this is Germany. We’re surrounded by Krauts. Norman sees a YOUNG TANKER running in circles holding an rifle above his head. Yelling this:

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG TANKER
dialogues.text: I’m a shithead! I’m a shithead! I’m a shithead! I’m a shithead!

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What’s that about? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: He was cleaning a machine gun and didn’t unload it. Nearly killed a Sergeant. Lucky he didn’t get stomped into the mud. Norman swallows hard. Looks around. Gordo angrily looks u from Norman’s dufflebag.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Where’s your cigarettes?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I don’t smoke.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Well then you’re a bastard. Gordo tosses Norman’s dufflebag in the mud. Norman looks stricken.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: You go to tank school?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I’ve never seen inside a tank. I’m a clerk typist. I was going to Fifth Corps HQ. They pulled me off the truck and sent me here. It’s gotta be a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Ain’t a mistake. Army does what it does.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Kid, you from Missouri? Norman shakes his head: “No”.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Chicago? Norman shakes his head: “No”.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Arkansas?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: No, I’m from -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: -- No one gives a damn where you're from. Gordo offers him his canteen. Norman politely takes a swi Spits it out.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: It tastes like hornet stings.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: You don’t drink?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Nuh-uh. Especially that. Gordo snatches back his canteen.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: I hate you.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: You a praying man?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I go to church.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Do you subscribe? Are you saved?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I’m baptized.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: That’s not what I’m asking. And you know it. Wait until you see it.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: See what?

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: What a man can do to another man.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Reverend-pastor-deacon Swan here was in a preacher factory when he got drafted.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: It’s called divinity college. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Praise Sweet Jesus. Thank you for the war dear sweet, sweet Jesus. Thank you for all the goddamned Nazi’s to kill.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Norman. There two are wicked men. Albeit amusing. You better grab hold of Jesus. He’s the one thing that won’t rattle you loose.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: «+. Sure... Coon-Ass pulls open the Bow Gunner’s hatch.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Here boy. Here’s your seat. Get a bucket of hot water from the kitchen and get it clean. Amish clean. Norman's face drops when he peers inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minutes later. Norman kneels awkwardly over the transmiss as he scrubs off blood with a rag. He pauses to stare at big belt fed machine gun - Also spattered with blood. He cleans it gently. As if afraid of waking a dangerous anim Norman removes blood spattered pin-up girls. And a photo Red's wife - The tough cattle ranching woman who has no i her man is dead. He reaches for a photo of Red in cowboy regalia astride a horse -- And freezes... WHAT HE SEES -- Blonde hair, an ear, a single blue eye. H of Red’s face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love Company’s tanks are being readied for combat. Gas ta are filled. Equipment is oiled and clean. Ammo loaded. Bu green monkeys scrambling over big green turtles. ON THE FURY: Coon-Ass and Bible load ammo into the turret Wardaddy and Gordo tighten track links with wrenches. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Norman scrambles out of the tank and tumbles over the sid Landing on his hands and knees, he vomits his ham and egg into the mud... Coughing and sputtering he looks up in time to see a 6x6 truck roll by, filled with a heap of corpses. German and American. Legs and arms sticking out. It looks like they waving “Hi” to the young soldiers... Norman wants to cry. The Fury’s crew stares at him. Blank faced. No sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Get back in there. It’s not going to clean itself. Norman stands, brushes off the mud. About to climb back i the tank, he pauses and stares with his mouth agape. Two TIRED GI’S escort and SS SERGEANT. His hands tied beh his back with bailing wire. His head is SWOLLEN like a watermelon. Puffy slits for eyes, blood slicked hair. He' taken a serious beating.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Why ain’t he sleepin’?

dialogues.speaker: TIRED GI
dialogues.text: G-Two wants a prisoner to question.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I‘1l question him. (in fluent German) What’s your favorite color? You like chicken or beef? You a good dancer? You like fat girls? The stoic prisoner blinks with confusion... THWICK! -- Wardaddy buries his knife in the SS Sergeant’s chest. Smack in the heart. And works it side to side. The GI’s shake their heads with weary dismay. Bible and C Ass pull Wardaddy away. Gordo cackles with delight.

dialogues.speaker: TIRED GI
dialogues.text: Okay, that kind of thing’s gonna get you in a lot of trouble.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: We ain’t here to ask them questions. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Tired GI's drop their prisoner. They look at Wardaddy like getting ready to do something about it. Coon-Ass aim his Tommy gun at them...

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: It’s a goddamned Kraut. Forget it. The SS man dies in the mud gasping his last breath. The t GI’s move along.

dialogues.speaker: TIRED GI
dialogues.text: I have to tell them what you did. Wardaddy ignores him. Norman watches the men go, shocked. Wardaddy spits. Wipes his knife clean.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: You killed a prisoner of war. In cold blood.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I know what I did. He’s an SS. They’re real assholes. Wardaddy shakes a smoke from his pack. Scratches another notch in his knife with his can opener.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I kill every SS I can. You’d seen what I seen you would too.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Fuck every last one. They started it. We’re finishing it.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Heinies don’t know they’re beat. Our Generals smell blood.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Yep. Ain’t nothing stopping the spear from sliding into the enemy’s belly.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: We're the spearhead. Done any killing? Norman shakes his head: no.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You will. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wardaddy shoves an ugly stamped metal submachine-gun into Norman's hands. The GIs call it a “greasegun”. The Lieute returns from the Company Command Post...

dialogues.speaker: LT. PARKER
dialogues.text: First Platoon TC’s! See me now. The first Platoon TANK COMMANDERS wander over to the Lieutenant. WARDADDY, SGT. BINKOWSKI, SGT. DAVIS and SGT. PETERSON, all rough men who can kick ass in a bar fight.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BINKOWSKI
dialogues.text: I see you sir. I see you.

dialogues.speaker: LT. PARKER
dialogues.text: Here's the big picture. Main Unit's going East. We’re going North on a flank guard mission. We’ll tie up with Baker Company from the 41st. Sergeant Collier is with us now. He'll be acting Platoon Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. PETERSON
dialogues.text: That’s fine with me. Glad to have you Don.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Sir, saying you get picked off? Mind showing me the overlay where we're going?

dialogues.speaker: LT. PARKER
dialogues.text: Sure, Collier. Kansas point Dog. After that we're working for Captain Waggoner. Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BINKOWSKI
dialogues.text: You started shaving? Lt. Parker disregards the dig...

dialogues.speaker: LT. PARKER
dialogues.text: First Platoon! Mount up and move out! The five tank commanders cross to their waiting tanks. Wardaddy makes the “crank it up” hand sign. Gordo slides the driver's hatch and starts the Fury. The other four tanks start up - their ENGINES ROAR. The 2 men of 1st Platoon take their fighting positions in side steel beasts. Wardaddy mounts the Fury. Norman too. One m confident and seasoned. The other clumsy and hesitant. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CAMERA FINDS - A CORPORAL arguing with Sgt. Davis.

dialogues.speaker: CORPORAL
dialogues.text: I can’t go out! I can’t do it! And you can’t make me! Sgt. Davis punches the man. And shoves him into the Bow Gunner’s hatch. It’s like stuffing a cat in a bathtub.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Battle fatigue case. Good man. He’s got his limit. We got ours.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Ought’a be psycho’ed to the rear. The Corporal extends his hand from the hatch, just his ha He’s hold a LIVE GRENADE. BOOM! -- It blows the Corporal’s hand clean off, shreds h forearm. Sgt. Davis is livid.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Bless you heart. You done went and did it. Get on, boy. Go suck your mama’s titty milk. Get on out of here you yellow fuck. The Corporal climbs out of the hatch, slides down the fro of the tank and trudges toward an ambulance clutching his shattered arm. Norman saw everything. He looks at Wardadd amazed and confused. Who just shrugs and locks and loads big .50 Cal machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Guess he didn’t want to go. Drive! Move out. The Fury falls in behind Lt. Parker’s tank. Then Sgt. Dav tank. Then Peterson and Binkowski’s tanks. The 5 tanks of lst PLATOON move out in a column. Each tan running over the dead SS Sergeant - Flattening him into t mud. No sentimentality here. It’s just business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Five Sherman Tanks are on the road heading East. They pass the OUTPOST TANK - Marking the scrimmage line betwee the American Army and the Nazis. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OUTPOST SENTRY
dialogues.text: Go fuck yourself Wardaddy! You owe me forty bucks. Wardaddy waves goodbye. The tank column passes a field wh dozens of foxholes are filled with INFANTRYMEN. At the so of a WHISTLE a hundred ragged green men emerge from the e like spawning locusts and shuffle towards waiting trucks. ON NORMAN - Sitting in the Bow Gunner’s seat, his hatch o The ass of the Lieutenant’s Tank spewing exhaust and dust his face. The Lieutenant keeps glancing back at Gordo, sitting in the Driver’s hatch. Gordo takes quick sips fro wine bottle between the young officer’s disapproving glan

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: We get hit, we’re gonna burn out. And we’re gonna burn out fast. Our tanks are shit boxes. German guns punch through them like butter. See this... He points at a hatch in the floor under his seat.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We get hit. I’m gone. Right through here. I ain’t waiting for you. I ain't helping you. Got that?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Okay. Thank you. Norman looks up at Wardaddy in the Commander's hatch. He looks like he was born like that - An iron centaur, half half tank. Wardaddy speaks to him through the intercom...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Kid, you hear me, you plugged in? Norman fumbles with the intercom switch, replies:

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I hear you, Sergeant.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Don’t fire that bow gun until I tell you. Got that? Don’t want you plastering our guys.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Okay, Sarge. (CONTINUED)
Gordo kills off his bottle of wine, throws it at the back the Lieutenant’s tank, shattering it.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Kid, you play cards? Blackjack? Poker?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: No. I don’t play cards.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: You motherfucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farmer's fields on either side. The tank column passes an FARMER riding a hay wagon pulled by two old horses. Colum of black smoke rise in the distance. Wardaddy spreads his on the turret. Marks their destination. Coon-Ass opens hi hatch, next to Wardaddy’s.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: What a chicken shit job. A goddamned side mission while main unit leapfrogs us. We need any support we’re fucked.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Ain’t this fucking war over yet?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: We're two hundred miles from Berlin. Get there just over a week.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: I’m in no hurry to get murdered in Berlin. Kids pouring bushels of grenades in our hatches. Wine bottles full’a gasoline. No thank you, ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I don’t want it to end.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: I’m ready to ship home. Work at the hog farm, marry me a little thing to make me pies and babies.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I never planned on surviving this thing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: A pretty little mama with a mess of cousins. Eat their pies too.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I'll keep looking at poker until I get my head shot off. Die owing every dripping dick in the battalion a stack of money.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Hurry up. You’re running out of war.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Don’t I know it.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: You just wanna keep killing people. You need it like you need breathing. Can’t do it back home. Not for long at least.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I got no home.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: If I get it first, you gotta promise to bury me face down.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: So you find your way to hell quicker?

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: So the whole damn world can kiss my ass. VROOM! - A P47 fighter flies over. So low that can count rivets on the wings. It quickly vanishes over the horizon ON NORMAN - Watching with fascination. He SEES another P4 fast approaching. VROOM! - It passes directly overhead. PAK-PAK-PAK-PAK-PAK! - A German anti-aircraft gun opens u 600 yards away it’s well camouflaged in a group of trees. It blows the wing off the low-flying fighter plane. The aircraft corkscrews into a field and EXPLODES VIOLENT as its bomb load detonates. Sudden. Shocking. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON WARDADDY - Spinning the turret with his thumb switch, lines up a shot on the anti-aircraft gun’s position.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Anti-aircraft! Two O'clock. Six hundred yards. HE! Fire when ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bible presses his face against the gun’s telescopic sight makes fine adjustments to the azimuth and elevation wheel the cannon. Then stomps the firing pedal...

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: On the way! KABOOM! - The gun recoils violently several feet, rocking tank. Coon-Ass immediately loads another shell into the breech - It slams shut - KERCHACK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NORMAN - Buffeted by the muzzle blast. He SEES the can shell - a glowing fireball - Arc into the German position KABOOM! - A direct hit. The distant target explodes with high order detonation - Burning and exploding ammunition rains down around it.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Love One-Two for Love-One. Target destroyed. We should head over there. Might be more Krauts to bag.

dialogues.speaker: LT. PARKER
dialogues.text: Negative, Collier. We’re on a timetable. They continue on their way. Leaving the carnage behind th Norman watches the greasy column of smoke from the crashe fighter and the destroyed German gun recede in the distan It all happened so fast. His first taste of combat and he never saw an enemy soldier.  23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The five tanks turn onto a paved road. It is crowded with REFUGEES - A long ragged column of German civilians fleei the bombings and marauding Russians to the East. OLD MEN, WOMEN, CHILDREN, once proud faces not dirty and scared. ON WARDADDY - Warily eying the flood of refugees. There’s 19th Century carriage being pushed by women. A car is pul by horses.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Okay. Button up. There might be a wolf hiding in the sheep. Kid, cast an eyeball on ‘em. Anyone makes a move you cut them right in half. Do what you need to do. If people are in the way, that’s their problem. You copy?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordo and Norman close their hatches. Norman looks at the machine gun. Hesitant. Gordo reaches over and cocks it fo him - KERCHACK!

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Gun’s ready. Just pull the trigger. Every five rounds is a tracer. So you can see what you’re hitting. Remember, short bursts. That way you'll harvest more meat per bullet. Norman REACTS. Looks through his periscope. NORMAN’S PERISCOPE POV - The world as seen through a rectangular piece of glass. He just sees a tired mass of people. Pathetic and harmless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Refugees move aside for the tanks. Among them are a d SOLDIERS - Schoolboy draftees - With no appetite for a fi They toss aside their weapons and raise white handkerchie Wardaddy, from his position high in the turret towers ove them, aims his assault rifle at them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (in German) Keep walking. American lines are that way. Keep going. Hands up high. There you go. Move. Lt. Parker is 50 feet ahead in his tank, he handsignals f Wardaddy to speed up. The tanks speed past the line of refugees. Tanks don’t like people near them.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. FURY, (MOVING)
dialogues.text: Gordo opens his hatch. Norman does the same. Grateful he didn’t have to shoot anyone. They pass a pretty girl ona bicycle. She smiles at Norman.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: There you go, boy. She’ll let you fuck her for a chocolate bar.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: That’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: That’s not true? Okay. It’s not true.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: It’s true. You can liberate her ass for a D-Ration bar. Or some smokes. Don’t give her a whole pack. Four will do it.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Ignore them. Don’t disappoint Christ. Don’t let them lead you astray.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: We can kill ‘em but we can’t fuck ‘em. Right? Cuz it’s in the bible.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: I’m done trying to convert you heathens. Mind if I continue invading Germany?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: You think Jesus loves Hitler? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: I would assume so. And if Hitler accepted Jesus in his heart and got baptized, he’d be saved. Won’t save him from man’s justice.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: What about your regular issue Nazi line trooper? He going to heaven?

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: You've been asking these same dumb questions for three years. You know where I stand.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Please save me. Sing me a hymn. Sing me “The Old Rugged Cross”. Sing it boy. Coon-Ass tickles Bible. For all their back and forth, the closer than brothers.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Stop, fool. I’1l shoot you.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Knock off the horseplay. (a beat, then) Boyd, you think Hitler would fuck one of us for a chocolate bar?

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: I hope so. I’d give it to him good. Slide this cannon right up his backside and punch out a Supercharge. Send the sonofabitch straight to Hell.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: That's awful Christian of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 5 tanks steadily approach their objective. Telegraph poles line the road. From those poles hang four YOUNG BOY about 10 or 11 - Big signs around their necks. The men in the Fury stare at the dead children. Wardaddy face to face with them. He’s up so high. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: What do the signs say? Wardaddy paraphrases the German scrawls on the signs.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: “I’m a coward and refused to fight for the German people.” (sadly) Kids. They're just kids. Then the body of a HOUSEWIFE.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “I helped traitors to Germany.” Norman gasps, looking at the bodies. Stunned by the sense cruelty.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: They did that shit in France and Belgium. Now they’re doing it to their own people. Let ‘em rip themselves to pieces. The tank column continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman watches the world go by through his periscope bloc Seeing Germany through the small glass prism... Norman's PERISCOPE POV - MOVEMENT in the ditch alongside Parker’s tank - An 11 Y.0. HITLER YOUTH aims a Panzerfaus anti-tank rocket at the Lieutenant’s tank - He’s a scared child, fear on his face, trembling. Norman can’t believe what he’s seeing - He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FWOOSH! - The Hitler Youth fires the rocket. It slams squ into the side of Lt. Parker’s tank... KABOOM! - A perfect hit on the ammunition storage. The re is instant and catastrophic as a jet of molten steel igni the cannon ammunition... A column of intense flame erupts from the commander's hat like a giant blow torch. Lt. Parker is immolated like a h candle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WARDADDY aims his assault rifle at the Hitler Youth... BRDDDDT! - Drops him with a burst. Two more HITLER YOUTH decide they are done playing soldier and take off running BRDDDDT!-BRDDDDT! - Wardaddy smokes the little fuckers to The four other tanks spread out into a cover formation... The burning tank rolls to a stop. The Driver’s hatch open The DRIVER crawls out - Flops on the ground, burning aliv he pulls his pistol from his shoulder holster... BAM! - And shoots himself in the head. Wardaddy and the other three tank commanders scanning for more Germans. All clear. Into radio...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Keep an eye out. Wardaddy climbs out of his hatch. Coon-Ass covers him wit big .50 Cal machine gun. Wardaddy approaches the burning tank. AMMUNITION begins t EXPLODE. It is a total loss. No survivors. Wait - The BOW GUNNER’S hatch opens. Belching fire and sm The A-DRIVE flails in the open hatch. Roasting alive. Trapped. Hopeless. BRDDDDT! - Wardaddy finishes him off. Then, he crosses to Hitler Youth in the ditch - He’s still alive. Wardaddy ki him. Reloads his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (German) You happy now you little shit? You should be in school drinking milk. You didn’t have to fight us you idiot. Wardaddy aims his weapon - BRDDT! - Ends the boy’s short lived war. He returns to the Fury. BANGS on Norman’s hatc with his gun butt.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Norman, open this goddamn hatch you cocksucker. Norman opens the hatch, scared of Wardaddy. Who wouldn’t (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why did you shoot that shithead when you had the chance?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: It happened so fast. He was just a kid. Wardaddy gestures at Lt. Parker’s burning tank.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: See what a kid can do? That’s your fault. Next fucking German with a weapon you see, rake the dogshit out of him. I don’t care if it’s a baby with a butter knife in one hand and mama’s left titty in the other. You chop him up. Wardaddy walks away leaving Norman destroyed and guilt wracked. Gordo looks at him, SEES he’s falling apart.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Okay, look. That stupid kid did that not you. I froze up before too. That’s why I like driving. You gotta kill Krauts? It’s them or us. Can you do it?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: ---I can do it...

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Okay. Then do it. This makes it easier. He offers Norman a bottle of wine. Norman declines. Warda shouts to Sgt. Davis’ tank.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Alight, Roy. Guess I’m it. I’1l lead the column. Let’s get where we're going.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Lead the way. Wardaddy climbs into the Fury’s turret. Double checks his map. Into his mic:

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Move out, driver. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Gordo puts the tank in gear and leads the column forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INFANTRYMEN dig foxholes. Eat chow. Clean weapons. Play cards. There are several HALF-TRACKS and TRUCKS. Two huge columns of thick black smoke rise from just over the next hill. The four tanks approach. An American INFANTRY SERGE flags them down.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Gordo, stop ‘er here. (to the Sergeant) Baker Company?

dialogues.speaker: INFANTRY SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Yessir.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I’m not a sir.

dialogues.speaker: INFANTRY SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Where’s your boss?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Dead.

dialogues.speaker: INFANTRY SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Who’s in charge ‘a this column?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: INFANTRY SERGEANT
dialogues.text: I'm talking to the right man. Park it. Old man’s waiting over there. EXT. FARMER’S FIELD - COMMAND HALF-TRACK - DAY The Infantry Sergeant leads Wardaddy to a COMMAND HALF-TR full of radios. A couple RADIOMEN monitor the CHATTER. IN B.G.: A MORTAR CREW fires rounds at distant German positions.

dialogues.speaker: INFANTRY SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Sir, tankers are here. CAPTAIN WAGGONER turns toward Wardaddy. This is an Office can respect. Rugged, solid. Big calloused hands. A confid veteran. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WAGGONER
dialogues.text: How many tanks you got?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Four.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WAGGONER
dialogues.text: I asked for ten. Here’s the deal - I got a platoon pinned in a sugar beet field by machine guns. I sent my tracks in an they got knocked out. The Boche as a 75 dug in and I need you to destroy it. They’re not old men and kids. It’s a regular Wehrmacht outfit. Help me kill them. Then we’ll push into town and kill the rest of the bastards. Main unit has Time on Target and aviation priority. So we’re on our own. I know who you are and I know you know what you’re doing. Let’s get it done. Wardaddy likes this guy. He taps the Captain’s map.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Seeing as they’re covering this road. Mind if I come in this way? Hit their flanks and roll ‘em up.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WAGGONER
dialogues.text: Do what you see fit. Just paste them hard. They murdered some good boys today. Why don’t they just quit?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Would you? Point taken. Wardaddy walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minutes later. MEDICS tend to four wounded GIs. Two dead are laid across the hood of a Jeep. Nearby a couple GUNNE in HALF-TRACKS fire bursts from their .50 Cals into the distant German positions. Wardaddy’s four tanks are in a row. The tank crews prepar them for combat. Weapons and ammo are double checked. Tra links are tightened. Norman helps Gordo top off the gas t with the help of a BLACK TRUCK DRIVER. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: This is it. We’re gonna see some action.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I’m scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: You'll be so fucking busy you won't have time to be scared.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: A hero’s just as scared as a coward. One quits. One don’t.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Don’t give him no hero bullshit. It’s a job. Everybody does their job, you win the game. Like a football team.

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: And the fellow that charges into danger to save his buddies? What is he?

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: A moron.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: How’s it feel to kill a man? Is it hard?

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Ever killed a hog? Butchered a hog? It’s just like that. Screaming and all.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: How would you know? Get in a knife fight in the whorehouse shitter back home?

dialogues.speaker: TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: They put me on the line in the Bulge. They don’t want us killing the white man. Until it’s their necks. I killed me a whole bunch. Krauts got real hot when they saw who was doing it. It was just like killing hogs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I'm from the city. I’ve only seen a cat get hit by an ice wagon.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: I'm from the city too. Chicago. And I seen lots of animals die. Papa worked in a slaughterhouse cutting up steers with an electric saw. Came up from Mexico to work there. Papa would cut off a piece of meat, swipe some kidneys or a tongue and sneak ‘em home. We ate beef every day. I started me there when I was fourteen. On the kill line. Hitting beef cows, old dairy cows, sometimes horses, between the eyes with a twelve pound sledgehammer. Right here. (taps his forehead) I'd be head to toe in blood, brains and snot. Whackin’ beefs all day until I couldn’t move my arms.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I helped in my dad’s stationary store. At the register. We sold sundries. Nothing that bled or screamed.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Too bad. It’s something. The kill line teaches you something.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: That it’s better to be the man with the hammer?

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coon-Ass and Wardaddy are alone in the turret. Coon-Ass i crying. His nerves are getting the best of him.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Don, I can’t do it. I can’t take any more. I don’t want to die. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I feel like I’m going to slide right out of my skin every time a goddamn shell goes off. I can’t do this. I don’t got the nerve.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: You can do it. You get worked up. Before an action. That’s all.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: This ain’t that. This is something different.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: No it’s your regular bullshit. You get the jitters. You bitch some and then you're fine. Grady, it’s your way.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Lookit the odds. We got four years of close calls. All the original boys are gone. Dead or mangled. We're it. Me, you and the Mexican. Out of how many? Some guys have been replaced four or five times. Replacement shows up one day. He’s dead the next. Why not us?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Sbut up. Shut your mouth. Don’t you spook that kid any more than he’s already spooked. We need him.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Remember that boy from Texas who was running and got hit by a shell? Listen to me. Don. Listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I remember.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: And his tank got hit by a Tiger and he bailed out and was running and a cannon shell hit him square in the back and he disappeared but his head flew straight up and landed in a tree. You remember that?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I said I remember. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Every night I dream his head’s ina tree singing to me. Soft and sweet like my mama’s songs when I was a baby. If I close my eyes right now, I'll see him.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Red's got us all a little sad right now. Grady. Look at my eyes, I’m talking. We gotta help this outfit. Then, you can get shit-yer-pants drunk and fuck some girls or something. How’s that sound?

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: You gonna drink with me?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: You know I won’t do that. I’m the foulest meanest damn drunk you can imagine. I’d stab you in the face and lick the blade clean.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Fine. I’1l drink that nice Cognac we found and roll around with some Nazi split-tails. I’m an ass man you know. Wish I had a stick of butter. Wardaddy smiles. Coon-Ass is ready to fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy does a final walk around his four tanks. He sees both man and machine are ready for battle. He turns to th two waiting INFANTRY SQUADS - About 20 men.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Let’s kill us some Germans. Mount up. The tired dogfaces climb aboard the tanks. Wardaddy climb aboard the Fury. Plugs in his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Start ‘em up and move out. The tanks start their engines and pull out. Each tank has least five soldiers riding on top.  35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four tanks move in a column. Shielded from the enemy small low hill. Fury leads the way - An OLD SERGEANT stan behind the turret mans the .50 Cal.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: You know what’s waiting for us?

dialogues.speaker: OLD SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. Wardaddy smiles at the old leathery bastard.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (into radio) All tanks this is Wardaddy. Form a shallow right echelon on me. When we hit the flat ground spread out to a hundred yard interval. On my signal we’ll drop the doughs and roll up that 75. Everyone copy?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Love One-Three copies. Wilco.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. PETERSON
dialogues.text: One-Four. Roger all.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BINKOWSKI
dialogues.text: This is Five. We got you Daddy. The column accelerates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy grinds his teeth in anticipation. The column is coming around the low hill...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: All thanks halt! The tanks stop. To the Old Sergeant...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get ‘em off.

dialogues.speaker: OLD SERGEANT
dialogues.text: You heard the man. Everyone off! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Soldiers spill off the tanks and take a knee. Close to th front line they stay low and wary. Some of the older salt immediately start digging foxholes.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: All tanks! Move out! Button up! The column begins to roll again. Hatches are closed. Only TANK COMMANDERS expose their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tanks churn up dirt as they enter the field. Spread o in the field is a PLATOON OF AMERICAN INFANTRY, laying in shallow trenches they scraped into the dirt between the furrows. They are pinned down by German machine guns. Sev are wounded or dead.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Okay! Fast left! Fast left! Let’s go! Start squirting them trees and bushes. The tanks fire their MACHINE GUNS - Streams of TRACERS fr the four tanks probe at any possible hiding place for Ger men and armor. This is called recon by fire...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman stares through his periscope. Trying to make sense the world outside the small glass rectangle.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Do I shoot?

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Yes. Start shooting.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What do I shoot at?

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Anywhere Nazis might hide. Norman pulls the trigger. The machine gun jackhammers violently. Adding to the deafening noise of the developin battle. Once over the initial shock of firing the weapon, smiles, empowered, and hoses every tree and bush in sight (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GORDO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t sit on the trigger! You’1l burn out the barrel! ON BIBLE - His face pressed against his gunsight. He fire bursts from the coaxial machine gun using the foot switch BIBLE’S GUNSIGHT POV - His tracers rake the distant ditch and bushes.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BINKOWSKI
dialogues.text: One-Five for Wardaddy. I see a bunch’ Krauts a hundred yards to my right.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: That’s our troops. Do not shoot them.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BINKOWSKI
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay I copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fury and the other three tanks drive abreast through field toward a row of hedges and trees... There are two BURNING HALF-TRACKS - The source of the bla smoke we saw earlier - Jagged holes in their armored side Surrounded by charred men and burning equipment. BRDDDDDDT! A GERMAN MACHINE GUN whips a long burst into t Fury. It sounds like an evil chainsaw. Sandbags, cases of ammo and Jerrycans of water are torn to shreds.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Goddammit! Bible hit that machine gun position! Eight hundred! Fire! KABOOM! The Main gun fires. The cannon round crashes into well camouflaged machine gun position. BOOM! The high explosive round detonates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coon-Ass jams a fresh round into the breech - KERCHACK! I his lap and loose at his feet are more big rounds.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Clear! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bible fires the instant he hears that. KABOOM! The cannon slams back in recoil, ejecting the spent shell. Coon-Ass another shell into the breech, punching it in with fist - KERCHACK! - The breech block slams shut... COON-ASS (CONT’D) Clear. KABOOM! - The gun fires. Recoils and ejects. Coon-Ass reloads. This veteran crew works like a Swiss watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! The last round nails the gun - Cartwheeling a GERMA SOLDIER through the air like a ragdoll.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Okay! Cease fire. That’s target destroyed. Wardaddy sees a tank has turned the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wardaddy for One-Five. Where are you going? Head North.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BINKOWSKI
dialogues.text: I’m heading North.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Dammit. Binkowski. No you are not. Turn right! Turn right! Head for that stand of trees and check it out.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BINKOWSKI
dialogues.text: One-Five copies. Wilco. Wardaddy SEES another of his tanks about to run over Amer soldiers.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Love One-Three! Fox Romeo! Pull your right brake! You got troops right in front of you! Get your head out of your ass! Love 1-3 swerves at the last second, just avoiding crushi several men. Wardaddy is already looking for the next pro to solve. It’s like herding cats.  39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tank is now a loud, smoky reverberating metal chamber engine noise and gunfire. Norman is getting the hang of i Firing the weapon into haystacks. Trees. Anywhere a Germa may be hiding. Empty shells cover the floor at his feet.. CLACK! - He runs out of ammunition. He grabs another box ammo. Reloads the hot gun. CRACK!-WHOOSH! - A hidden German cannon fires a high velo round that rips right past Wardaddy’s head. It’s a tank killer and a grave danger...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Fuck! Where’s that gun! Who sees it? Who sees the gun shooting us?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. PETERSON
dialogues.text: One-Four for Wardaddy. It’s ours. I think that’s a howitzer from the company area.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Bullshit! It’s not ours. It’s a Kraut high velocity gun. I can hear it whistling. Where the fuck is it?! CRACK-WHOOSH-KTANG! The hidden German cannon fires again, hitting Love One-Four. Fortunately, the round glances off careens into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Believe me now?!

dialogues.speaker: SGT. PETERSON
dialogues.text: Anti-tank! Right front! Right front! Nine hundred! Love 1-4 fires its main gun at the hidden German cannon.. KABOOM! VREEE! The tank round falls short, hit the ground ricochets sharply. All four tanks begin to fire at the cannon’s position. KABOOM-KABOOM-KABOOM! Round after round detonates in quic succession. Stripping the stand of trees bare. Splinterin their trunks. KAWOOP! Success! The cannon position detonates with a gre black explosion - THEN... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: CRACK-WHOOSH! A second 75mm Anti-tank gun opens fire! KTANG! Love 1-4 is hit again. The German cannon round mak massive burst of sparks and ricochets away. SGT. PETERSON (CONT’D) I’m hit. Pulling back!

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: There’s another gun! Who sees it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman fires his machine gun at a more distant group of trees. NORMAN'S PERISCOPE POV - His stream of tracers cuts into group of trees and suddenly deflects upward - From the camouflaged German ARMOR PLATE hidden there...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: There’s something there! At, uh, ten O'clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy SEES the stream of deflected tracer fire.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Got him! Anti-tank! Left front! One two hundred. HE. Superquick. Gordo, head right at him. Gunner! Traverse left! Steady... On it! Fire! KABOOM! The Fury’s main gun fires - BOOM! - The shell cra into the cannon position, igniting its stock of ammo. KABOOM! A massive secondary explosion obliterates the 75m tank gun.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Target destroyed! Okay, One-Four you’re too damn close to me. Maintain your interval. All tanks, move forward. Let’s go. Let’s clean it up. The four tanks straighten up their line and drive for the German positions. They near twenty foxholes, each with tw GERMAN SOLDIERS inside.  41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman loading a fresh belt of ammo... GORDO’S PERISCOPE POV - A GERMAN SOLDIER stands up and ai Panzerfaust at the Fury.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Get him! Kill him! Norman finishes loading the belt. COCKS the gun. Looks through his periscope. NORMAN'S PERISCOPE POV - BRDDDDT! Bible shreds the German Soldier with the coaxial machine gun. Beating Norman to the punch. Gordo glares at Norman.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do your job. Do what you’re here for. Do it now.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I was loading the gun. Norman grits his teeth and begins firing. Moving the gun side to side. Utterly lacking in finesse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four tanks hose down the foxholes with their machine guns. Several Germans jump up and wave white handkerchief surrender. They are shot down. Wardaddy SEES a machine gun position - Three GERMANS cowe behind their dug-in heavy machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Machine gun, twelve o’clock. Gordo! Run them bastards over! Gordo guns the engine. The Fury lurches forward. The thre Germans try to flee from their foxhole. It is too late - Two of them are crushed. The third man cringes at the bottom of the deep hole. Gordo stops over Works the steering levers back and forth... The tank turns from side to side, grinding apart the Germ position, burying the last man alive. The four tanks cont firing their machine guns into the foxholes. Chewing apar the huddle GERMAN SOLDIERS.  42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordo turns to Norman.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Squirt them Krauts there. On yer left. See ‘em? NORMAN'S PERISCOPE POV - There is a cluster of dead Germa Soldiers, cut down when they tried to run for it.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: The dead bodies? They’re already dead.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: You a doctor? How you know they’re dead? Hit ‘em. So they can’t jump up and shoot us in the ass. Norman looking at Gordo. He just can’t do it. Gordo shake his head in frustration. And turns the tank toward the bo and runs them over. Norman begins to cry. Not simply a tear down the cheek bu roar of anguish, good honest pain...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I can’t be here. I can’t be here.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Turn your goddamn intercom off it you're gonna ball like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fury turns side to side grinding dead Germans into th mud. Wardaddy gets on to the big .50 Cal machine gun... RAT-AT-AT-AT-AT-AT! He fires into the foxholes, chewing u dirt, men, and equipment. Soon the German dead have all been adequately “double tap by the four tanks. An everyday procedure. The firing slackens. And stops. Just the occasional burst from a tan BOW or COAX MACHINE GUN.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: All tanks. Let’s hold here. One- Four. You better take care of that fire. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The packs on Love 1-4 are still burning. Wardaddy looks behind them and SEES the pinned Platoon from Baker Compan rise to their feet. These are the men the tanks have just rescued. There is no celebration. No back slapping. The Infantry Soldiers know that only more hard fighting awaits them. The men they dropped off have moved up. The platoons of soldiers inspect the Kraut foxholes... A couple CREWMAN in Love 1-4 douse their burning packs wi fire extinguishers. Then cut them off.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wardaddy for Love-Four and Five. Pull up there fifty yards and cover that road.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. PETERSON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Love one-four wilco.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Love One-Six for Baker Six. We cleared out the machine guns and the anti-tank. You’re fine to roll up your vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WAGGONER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Baker Six copies. We’re gonna catch up and then we’ll push into town.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Love One-Six copies. Wardaddy slides out of the turret. Encounters the Old Sergeant waving his men forward...

dialogues.speaker: OLD SERGEANT
dialogues.text: First Platoon get up here and get this trash policed up! Second Platoon pass through and dig in along that ditch. I want an outpost on that hill. The Old Sergeant gives Wardaddy a grateful nod. The 1st Platoon Soldiers search the dead. Taking watches rings. Anything of value. 2nd Platoon (the soldiers that Wardaddy just rescued) stand and move forward to establis new defensive line. Some don’t get up. The MEDICS search injured among the dead. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: POW! A Soldier finishes off a wounded German - The German body is missing from the waist down. Wardaddy bangs on Norman’s hatch. Norman opens it with trepidation.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I had the best Assistant Driver in the entire Ninth Army in that seat. Now I got you. I promised my crew a long time ago I'd keep them alive. You're getting in the way of that. It ain’t like the newsreels up front.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. Okay? I’m trained to type 60 words a minute, not machine gun dead bodies. I’m trying my best. Maybe you’ve never been scared, but I’m so damn scared I can’t breathe. I got three hours in a tank. Three. How many do you got? Backtalk?! From this peachfuzzy teenager? Wardaddy is incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: REDNECK SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Hey lookit here we got a live one. Get the fuck outta there boy. A feral, dirt-shiny REDNECK SOLDIER drags a middle-aged GERMAN CORPORAL out of a foxhole. The man is terrified. Trembling. He’s the last German alive - now surrounded by dozens of pissed off American troops. Dark unshaven faces Eyes burning with fever and exhaustion. The Old Sergeant makes a throat cutting motion. The Plato Soldier is about to shoot the German Corporal...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Hang on. Wardaddy yanks Norman out of his hatch. Holds him by the neck, he frogmarches him over to the German Corporal. Who pictures of his wife and kids in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: GERMAN CORPORAL
dialogues.text: Meine kinder! Meine frau!

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Halt die Fresse! Wardaddy slaps the pictures from the man’s hands. He pull the .45 From his shoulder holster and hands it to Norman. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wardaddy spins the prisoner and kicks him to the dirt. No looking at the big pistol. Bible watching this unfold from the Fury’s turret. Gordo watches from the driver’s hatch. Coon-Ass stops tossing o fired cannon shells to watch too. WARDADDY (CONT’D) You're no goddamned good to me if you can’t kill Krauts. Put a big fat hole in his back. Some of the Platoon soldiers pause and watch the show. Ot drift away and continue searching dead Germans. There is simply no way Norman can shoot this sobbing father in the back. He looks at Wardaddy with defiance.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: No. I’m not doing it.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Why the hell not?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: It’s not right. He hands the pistol back. Wardaddy looks like he’s going hit Norman with it. Instead he holsters it. And walks awa Then Wardaddy pauses. Thinks to himself: “Fuck this, I’1l this round.” He strides back over to Norman. Grabs him by throat and shoves him to his knees. He holds his .45 To Norman’s head.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: We ain’t here for right and wrong. We're here to kill these people. Platoon Soldiers gather to watch - this is getting interesting. Wardaddy cocks the hammer.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You or him. Your pick. You or him.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Do it. Kill me. Norman has called his bluff. Enraged, Wardaddy forces the into Norman’s - then wrestles the pistol against the back the German Corporal’s neck, who is falling apart sobbing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GERMAN CORPORAL
dialogues.text: Nicht shiesen! Bitte! Nich shiessen! Wardaddy crams Norman’s finger onto the trigger guard and mashes it against the trigger. BAM! The pistol fires. Into the German’s brain stem. Kill him instantly. Norman sags in defeated horror. Wardaddy holsters his pistol and walks away. Leaving Norman on his knees in the mud. A HUGE DIRTY SOLDIER steps in and rolls the dead German Corporal over - He takes his watch and wedding ring. Bibl walks over to Norman. He helps the kid up.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: C’mon. Leads back to the Fury. Where Coon-Ass hands Norman a hot of coffee. Norman accepts it gratefully. Wardaddy is by himself smoking a cigarette, maybe feeling a little guilt

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: That was a shit show. Was that supposed to make a man out of me? My conscience is clean. I’m keeping it that way. The Fury crews trade looks. They’ve all been there. Gordo puts a brotherly arm around Norman.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Don's crazy as a shithouse rat. But he’s solid. We’ve been together since before Africa. I won’t fight with nobody else.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: He’s the biggest asshole I ever met, and I’ve met a couple.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Ain’t no crew stayed together like we have. And it’s because of him. Look, you did alright. You spotted that 75 when no one else did. A kind word. Norman needed it. The crew is starting to ac him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: First time we got shot at in North Africa, Don shit his drawers. Stunk the tank up real good. Norman looks at Wardaddy. Unable to imagine him ever afra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy’s four tanks lead the men and vehicles of Baker Company to their next objective. Infantry Soldiers ride o the tanks, ten or more on each. They are followed by seve HALF-TRACKS. Norman's hatch is open. He looks across at Gordo - who gi him a reassuring nod. UP IN THE SKY - Flying at 30,000 feet is a massive format of nearly a 1000 B-17 bombers! A white band of contrails covers the sky. The formation is several miles long. An astounding vision. Around the bomber formation are the corkscrewing contrails of fighters engaged in dogfights. Norman watching this entranced. The other tankers and soldiers are enthralled by the spectacle. Wardaddy watche the bombers with admiration...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: There you go, boys. Keep pounding them. There is a bright flash and a bomber falls out of the sky The tankers and soldiers watch the distant bomber spin sl towards the ground like a giant falling maple seed. The column of men and machines continues up the road. The pass two mangled German Army Horse-drawn Wagons. Shattere fighter plane rockets, a twisted tangle of dead German soldiers and horses. An OLD WOMAN is hacking off hunks of horseflesh. She glares at the Americans with pure hate.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: There you go, kid. She’s sure as shit fuck you for a chocolate bar. Norman looking at Gordo. Scandalized by that. Then, he cr a smile at the sheer absurdity - Norman is starting to be a frontline soldier.  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The column has halted. The four tanks are spread out abre The Infantry Soldiers have dismounted from the tanks and shelter behind them. Wardaddy scans the town with German binoculars. His jaw muscles ripple as he grinds his teeth. WHAT HE SEES - A typical small North German village. Hous and shops clustered around a couple intersections. He get the company net...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Baker Six from Love One-Six. I don’t see white sheets. And nobody's out. I think we’re looking at a fight. Over.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WAGGONER, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Baker Six copies. Higher wants this place secured by fifteen hundred German O'clock. Go ahead and get in there. Mortar section’s standing by. They’re all we got so don’t get in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Baker Six from Love One-Six. Wilco. Commencing assault from LOD now. Over. Wardaddy grabs the mike for the Platoon net.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All tank. Listen up, we’re going in. Move out. And let’s button up until we know what’s in there. Love One-Three, take the right, outside that line of buildings. One Four, you take the left, I’1l take point on the wedge. Binkowski, you’re on me. Stay twenty yards off my ass. The four tanks move forward toward the town. Love 1-3 and Love 1-4 leave the road and split off around either side the village. The tanks move slow - so the Platoon Soldier foot can keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fury enters the sleepy rural village. Nobody is in si Except for a bent OLD MAN in a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (German) Grandpa. Where are the German soldiers? The Old Man points at a HOTEL down the road. POW! A single rifle shot his the Old Man, dropping him instantly. Wardaddy grabs the hands of his .50 Cal and le it rip on the Hotel building. RAT-AT-AT-AT-AT-AT-AT! Thumbsized armor piercing bullets smash into the Hotel. Blasting off chunks of masonry.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bible, follow my burst. Throw a round of HE into that open second story window.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: On the way - KABOOM! The cannon fire, the round impacts the building. BOOM! The round EXPLODES dropping most of the second stor facade - exposing 6 GERMAN SOLDIERS, stunned by the blast POW-POW-POW-POW-POW! The Platoon Soldiers crouched behind Fury eagerly light them up with their rifles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman's face is pressed against his periscope. NORMAN'S PERISCOPE POV - A GERMAN SOLDIER runs right in f of the tank. Without thinking Norman opens fire. BRDDDDDDDT! Dropping the German to the street. His rifle CLATTERS across the cobblestones. Norman realizes what he did. He leans back and takes a de breath. Gordo pats his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: That’s all it is. Keep going. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Good one, kid. Keep stacking ‘em up. Norman wipes the sweat from his brow. Settles in behind t periscope. Hunting for more targets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Platoon Soldiers take cover in doorways. Staying close to walls. They kick in doors and methodically clear each building. The Fury and Love 1-5 slowly advance. Wardaddy two stories high in his turret... ON HIS LEFT - A GERMAN SOLDIER in a second story window a a submachine gun at him... Wardaddy - Almost face to face with the German - Grabs hi assault rifle and aims. BRDDT - Killing the soldier. Wardaddy scans the upper stories around him for more thre BRDDDDT! A German heavy machine gun opens up. It is cleve dug into a cellar in the base of a building. Its chainsaw roar echoes off the buildings. Its deadly tracers rake th street... Two Platoon Soldiers are hit and drop - The Machine gun i too close to the Fury for the tank to get a good shot.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Binkowski, see that Kraut stinger in the cellar there? Mind giving him what for?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. BINKOWSKI
dialogues.text: Sure, Daddy. I’1l1 slap him around. You better button up. Wardaddy gets inside the turret. Closes his hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy watches through his periscope... KAPOW! 1-5 fires a High Explosive shell right next to Fur (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BOOM! The shell blasts a hole in the building’s exterior wall. Silencing the machine gun. Falling brickwork lands the Fury...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy opens his hatch, bricks cover the tank. A German Soldier staggers out of the exposed building. Bleeding fr the ears and disorientated... Wardaddy pulls his .45 And takes careful aim - POP! Drops with one shot - Then out of nowhere: BOOM-KTANG! A German anti-tank shell glances off the turr with a SHOWER OF SPARKS and smashes into the building. Wardaddy is stunned by the close call. Wiping his eyes, choking on brick dust... NEW ANGLE - A Small German antitank gun is hidden inside tailor shop. The crew frantically reloading.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Antitank! Left! Fox Love! Phosphorous! Five zero! Fire when ready!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the amazing skill of an experienced tank crew. Coo Ass unloads the High Explosive shell in the breech and sh in a SMOKE ROUND - Bible traverses the turret on the targ Gordo works the steering levers bringing the thick armor the tank’s front to face the enemy gun... Norman joins in - Firing a long burst into the Tailor sho His tracer rounds bouncing off the guns armor shield...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fury and her turret spin quickly - Lining up on the tailor shop. KABOOM-POW! - The white phosphorous shell detonates insid Explodes with a white burst of noxious smoke - Spraying burning phosphorous everywhere... The four man GUN CREW flees into the street. Trailing whi smoke - Phosphorous burning deep into their flesh. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRDDDDDDDDT! Norman mows them all down. All four men. End their misery. CLOSE ON NORMAN'S PERISCOPE - We can see his eyes through glass prism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman gawks through the periscope at their smoking corps It sinks in what he’s done. He doesn’t like it.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Gunner, put an HE in there. Smash that gun. KABOOM-BOOM! The Fury fires a High Explosive shell into t tailor shop. Not taking any chances. The Fury continues forward. Its steel tracks CLANKING on the cobblestones of tiny farming village. Love 1-5 follows close behind FIRIN BURST OF TRACERS into upper story windows. The Platoon Soldiers filter through the buildings behind them. Checking for enemy soldiers. Small teams of soldier leapfrogging up the street. All business. Unhurried and cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fury and Love 1-5 enter the square and spread out. Ea covering their respective sides. A door opens... Wardaddy swings his .50 Cal on an older man waving a whit pillowcase - He’s the town BURGERMEISTER. White sheets suddenly appear from several windows. The Burgermeister cautiously approaches the Fury.

dialogues.speaker: BURGERMEISTER
dialogues.text: (in German) Please. Stop shooting. The remaining soldiers wish to surrender. I am trying to save my village. The people have suffered so much.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (in German) Thank your buddy Hitler for that. Where are the German soldiers? How Many are there and what weapons do they have? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BURGERMEISTER
dialogues.text: (in German) They are in the bank. There are thirty. They are not soldiers. They are children. The SS made them fight. He points at a DEAD TEENAGER hanging from a lamppost with another of those damn signs “I am a coward”.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (in German) You tell them to come out with their hands held high and empty. (in Radio) All tanks, hold your fire until I say so. I got the mayor here and I think they're surrendering. Binkowski load an HE and get ready to put it in that bank if these people want to test us. Wardaddy nods for the Burgermeister to go ahead. He cross to the bank, under dozens of watchful American weapons. Wardaddy scanning the area for threats. It’s tense. The Burgermeister SHOUTS for the soldiers to come out. AT THE BANK - The front doors open. A line of dejected ki emerges in eclectic uniforms. BOYS and GIRLS. Their hands held high, faces scared. The Platoon Soldiers surge forward and search them.
