Among them is an SS OFFICER, his arm in a sling. Wardaddy point him out to the Burgermeister.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) Is he the man who has been hanging the children? The Burgermeister looks nervous - The SS Officer is glari right at him. Nevertheless, the Burgermeister nods: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey! Shoot that guy! Yeah, him. The SS cocksucker with the busted wing. Without hesitation, a young SKINNY SOLDIER pulls the Ss Officer from the line, aims his Tommy gun at him and... BRDDDDDT! Stitches the hardened Nazi from crotch to throa The Burgermeister gives Wardaddy a grateful nod.  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER - The Company vehicles have joined the tanks. With day’s work over for them. Baker Company’s SOLDIERS swarm the town, searching houses, collecting weapons. SOLDIERS stack the dead Germans. MEDICS treat the wounded SOLDIER drags a mattress down the street. Another sits in big stuffed chair on the sidewalk smoking a cigar.

dialogues.speaker: OLD SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Dig in! We’re gonna be here a while! Bible scoops helmet-fulls of empty machine gun brass out the turret. Gordo sleeps under the tank. Coon-Ass boils w in his helmet over a fire made of broken chair legs. Norman stands outside the Fury trying to comprehend what has seen. Wardaddy approaches him. Offers his hand. Norma shakes. Wary of this volatile veteran.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: It wasn’t nothing right?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Come again, Sergeant?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Rubbing out them Heinies. You splashed ‘em real good. Wasn’t nothing right? Norman looks at Wardaddy - realizes he NEEDS Norman to ag with him - To agree it’s nothing to kill people. As if No can give Wardaddy absolution for all the men he’s killed. Norman lies and tells him what he wants to hear.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Sure, Sergeant. It wasn’t nothing. In fact, I kinda liked it. Norman is a bad liar. Wardaddy thinks for a moment. Then:

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I want you to see something. Wardaddy leads Norman down the street - to the front door the local NAZI PARTY HEADQUARTERS.  55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy pushes the door open. He and Norman gaze upon a shocking sight... WHAT THEY SEE - There are several dead men and women. The wear Nazi Party Uniforms, middle-aged fat bureaucrats. Th women wear party dresses. Presumably their wives. Empty b bottles everywhere. Several of the men hold pistols.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: They knew we were coming. So they got drunk as Lords and shot themselves at sun up. A beat as Norman stares at this man tableau...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Why are you showing me this?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: You know why. Wardaddy walks away. Norman follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy and Norman head down the street. Two GIs pass th clutching wine bottles - both wear top hats and sunglasse

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Keep doing what I say. You do that and you'll get through this thing. CRASH! - SOLDIERS searching a building heave a dumpster o the window. It bursts open on the cobblestone street. Wardaddy SEES a face in the window on the upper floor of nearby apartment building. He quickly heads for it.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C’mon.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What’d you see?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Krauts. Wardaddy grabs Norman’s greasegun - cocks it and hands it back. He takes the safety off his assault rifle and boots front door.  56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy quickly charges up the stairs... Norman follows. They reach an apartment door on the top story. Wardaddy POUNDS it with the stock of his assault rifle. A WOMAN opens the door - Her name is IRMA - The fe on her face is plain as day.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (in German) Who's in here?

dialogues.speaker: IRMA
dialogues.text: (in German) Just me.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Wardaddy forces his way inside. INT. GERMAN TOWN - WOMAN’S APARTMENT - DAY It has surprisingly modern furniture and decor. Wardaddy quickly searches the place. Norman follows his around lik puppy. Wardaddy checks closets. Cupboards. Anywhere a hum being can hide. He enters a bedroom and looks under the b SOMEONE is hiding underneath.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (in German) Get out of there. Right now. Hurry up. Norman watches a gorgeous young lady slide out from under bed. This is EMMA - she’s 18 - Norman’s age. Wardaddy hel her up. Norman is transfixed by her. Wardaddy drags Emma from the bedroom by her wrist. Wardad turns to Norman.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Close the door and lock it! Norman freezes - Things are going to a bad place.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lock the fucking door! Norman complies. Slowly closing and locking the front doo Irma is just sick with fear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: IRMA
dialogues.text: (in German) Please, leave her alone.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (in German) You said nobody was in here. You could have gotten her killed.

dialogues.speaker: IRMA
dialogues.text: She's my cousin. I’m sorry. Please. I was afraid of --

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: -- I know what you were afraid of. Wardaddy pushes Emma onto the couch. Then sits down in a chair. He takes off his helmet. Leans his rifle against t wall. Suddenly looking very tired. He looks at Irma.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Get me some hot water. For shaving. (to Norman) Sit the fuck down. Put the gun away. You make me nervous. Norman stiffly sits on the couch with Emma. It’s awkward. Like a bad blind date.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s your name young lady?

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (in German) Emma.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Emma, you know how to cook? The girl nods: yes. Wardaddy reaches in his musette bag. out a soap dish. He opens it and carefully unwraps four e Precious rare eggs. Then he takes out a can of coffee. And a can of bacon. He offers the rare treasures to Emma. Her eyes light up and joyfully accepts them. As a bonus Wardaddy gives her two packs of smokes. She happily joins Irma in the kitchen. Norman relaxes. Wardaddy isn’t here to rape and kill them Norman takes off his helmet. And takes off his jacket.  58. INT. GERMAN TOWN - WOMAN’S APARTMENT In the kitchen - Irma savouring an American cigarette as cooks bacon and eggs. She sips from her cup of fresh coff The first in years. Norman is asleep on the couch. Wardaddy stands before a p of steaming hot water. He has peeled off his jacket, over and shirt - Hideous burn scars cover his back. Emma crosses to Norman and gently wakes him, offers hima steaming cup of coffee. Norman smiles at her. He likes he She smiles back. She likes him. She sits next to him. Thi to thigh. Norman SEES Wardaddy’s burns and REACTS - Embarrassed by them, Wardaddy puts his shirt back on. Emma holds Norman’s hand. Then tries to pull him off the couch. Norman realizes where this is going. And blushes. shakes his head: no. Wardaddy slides a fresh blade in his safety razor.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: She's a good clean girl. You don’t take her in that bedroom, I will. Emma intuits what Wardaddy has said and clings to Norman' arm. Norman looks at Wardaddy. At the girl. Wardaddy doesn’t really want her. But Norman doesn’t know that. Norman mak his decision. He leads Emma into the bedroom. She shuts t door behind them. Wardaddy smiles. Like a proud big brother. He works up a lather with his shaving brush. NEW ANGLE - Irma steps out of the kitchen, arms crossed, a disapproving look.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in German) They're young. And they’re alive. He carefully scrapes off the dirt and whiskers with the s razor. Irma stands there smoking, watching him shave. It’ nice having a man in the house.

dialogues.speaker: IRMA
dialogues.text: You speak good German. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I know. He’s not interested in her. She was hoping he was. She returns to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coon-Ass has been waiting impatiently outside the Fury. Finally Gordo exits the tank turret, buttoning his trouse with a satisfied look.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Batter up. Coon-Ass climbs into the tank. Bible looks on disapprovin

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: I hope you get scabies.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Burnt motor oil kills the little fuckers right off. I'll save a slice for you. You need to get your dick wet, sky pilot. Gordo grabs a wine bottle. Takes a swig.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Where’s Wardaddy? Daddy? Where you hiding? Don’t leave your family on the street? Daddy?? Bible nods toward the Apartment building. INT. GERMAN TOWN - WOMAN’S APARTMENT IN THE BEDROOM - Norman has her hand in his, he’s reading palm.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: This is the ring of Solomon. You help people. And understand them. It’s really rare. See mine? I got it too. He shows her his hand. Then continues her reading... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: NORMAN (CONT’D) This is your heart line. You’re going to have one great love in your life. My grandma taught me how to do this. People came from all over to see her. Okay, this is your life line... Norman pauses. Looks at her. It’s not good news. She sees the change in him. Decides to lighten the mood. peels top off. Norman’s eyes lock on her breasts. She’s p of them, as she should be. With the ice broken, Norman ma his move and kisses her. She takes his pants off. He’s sh She likes that.

dialogues.speaker: EMMA
dialogues.text: (in German) Don’t be afraid. I’m not going to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re saying. Emma shushes him with a finger. She rolls him on his back mounts him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINUTES LATER - Coon-Ass is screwing the very plump TOWN WHORE. Pig fucking is a better description. Pure mindless carnality. How did she fit in the tank? INT. GERMAN TOWN - WOMAN’S APARTMENT Irma singing in German as she works in the kitchen. Norma exits the bedroom. Looking flushed and content. Wardaddy, cleaned up, is a different man. Norman sits on the couch. Gathering his thoughts.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: You don’t need to say nothing. They sit there in silence. Wardaddy sipping his coffee. E exits the bedroom. Glowing. She joins Irma in the kitchen quietly scolds her. BANGING at the door. Wardaddy nods for Norman to get it. woman peer around the corner, frightened. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Norman opens the door - It’s Coon-Ass, Gordo and Bible. T three men enter. Take off their helmets. Set down their weapons. Coon-Ass and Gordo are drunk.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Boy, it’s time for you to act the man. We got you fixed up good. A special gal’s down there waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: You're too late. Emma brings the new arrivals glasses of beer. Coon-Ass dr over the beautiful young woman. She returns quickly to th kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Bless you heart, boy. You took that pretty thing for a roll? Norman won’t answer him. And that’s answer enough. COON-ASS (CONT’D) We're a team, right? Eat, shit, kill, fuck together. Right?

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: That's right. Pass the plate, Norman. Make a donation to the cause.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Y'all touch her and I’m kicking your teeth down your throats. Coon-Ass smiles. Rubs Wardaddy’s smooth face.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: You're so pretty, can I fuck you?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Have at it. There’s a jar of grease in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Sissy bastard. Coon-Ass regards a photograph on the wall. A young man in Army uniform. He takes it down, dismayed. COON-ASS (CONT’D) Who’s the goddamn Nazi? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Coon-Ass charges into the kitchen with it - Indignantly w the picture at Irma... COON-ASS (CONT’D) Who's the fucking Nazi, lady?

dialogues.speaker: IRMA
dialogues.text: (in German) My husband. He died in Russia. Wardaddy appears behind Coon-Ass and takes the photo from him. He gently hands it to Irma.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (in German) I’m sorry for your loss. Norman is touched by this respectful side of Wardaddy. Co Ass sits down. Pulls a bottle from his jacket and takes a swig. Coon-Ass hands it to Norman. And stares at him with angry, bloodshot eyes...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You best take a bite. Norman hesitates, then takes a swig. Winces from the burn

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Sure that’s not gasoline?

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Pure white lightening. Some of the Georgia boys cooked it up. Suddenly there’s a WOMAN’S SCREAM followed by a GUNSHOT f outside. Emma and Irma trade scared looks. Norman gets up and looks out the window... WHAT NORMAN SEES - A DRUNK SOLDIER exits the bank with an load of Reichsmarks and tosses them in the air.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Get back from that window. Before those drunk ass fools kill the hell out of you. Norman carefully backs away.  63. INT. GERMAN TOWN - WOMAN’S APARTMENT - DAY (LATER) Norman, Wardaddy, Coon-Ass, and Bible sit at the table ea bacon and eggs. Emma toast thin slices of black bread. Ir pours the men little glasses of Schnapps. She sets a glas front of Wardaddy. He pushes it away with his finger.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (in German) No thank you.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: You like horses?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I told you, I’m a city kid.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Don likes horses. Right, Don?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I’m eating. We’re eating.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: In France we hit the beach right after D-Day and fought through all those fucking hedgerows. We finally broke out into open country. And bypassed all these Kraut divisions. We linked up the Canadians and British and trapped an entire Kraut Army pulling back to Germany. We fucked them up. With planes and artillery. Dead Krauts and horses and busted up tanks and cars for miles. Miles. Your eyes see it but your head can’t make no sense of it. We go in there. And for three whole days we shot wounded horses. All day long. Sun up to sundown. Putting down horses. Hot summer days. Ain’t smelled nothing like it. The sound of it. Those fucking horses screaming. Black clouds of flies buzzing. Like being ina giant bee hive. Norman's eyes bug. He’s lost his appetite.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: That’s really a fine story. Pleasant meal time talk. Thank you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: It’s what happened. And what happened, happened. And what’s gonna happen is gonna happen. And playing house with a couple bitch Krauts won't change much, will it?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: The seventh seal’s broken, buddy. You can’t put the shit back in the horse. Wardaddy pulls his .45 And SLAMS it on the table. Coon-As backs down. A painfully tense silence follows. Wardaddy’s fork scrapes against his plate as he shovels eggs and bac into his mouth. Finally he looks at Norman. Smiles warmly

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Your mama a good cook?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: She’s a really good cook.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: How’s her fried chicken?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: She doesn’t fry chicken. She roast it with stuffing. Or makes chicken and dumplings. That’s my favorite. She bakes too. Pies and cakes and -- A KNOCK at the door. Norman gets up and answers. It’s the COMPANY MESSENGER.

dialogues.speaker: COMPANY MESSENGER
dialogues.text: Where’s Love One-Six?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: COMPANY MESSENGER
dialogues.text: Old man wants you.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.speaker: COMPANY MESSENGER
dialogues.text: You got a mission. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The men look at each other. Their short respite is over. Wardaddy finishes his coffee. Pushes his chair back and stands. His men stand too.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (in German) If you’ll excuse us, please. (to the guys) Let's go. He crosses, grabs his helmet and weapon.

dialogues.speaker: IRMA
dialogues.text: (in German) Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: To take the next town. And the next one. And the next one. Until you people quit.

dialogues.speaker: IRMA
dialogues.text: What’s going to happen to us?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Irma stands stoically. Hands folded in front of her. Lips pursed. Norman grabs his greasegun. Slips on his helmet. hateful to leave. Just hateful. Emma runs to him and hold to him for dear life. Coon-Ass grabs the boy by the scruf and drags him away.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: There’s a lot more of them. To the Company Messenger, on his way out - RE: the women.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Make sure none of the boys give them a hard time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside a nice house with antiques and Persian rugs. Capta Waggoner goes over a map with Wardaddy.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WAGGONER
dialogues.text: Grasshopper spotted a troop concentration moving west. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WAGGONER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Higher wants your armor guarding these crossroads in Ohio Queen on the overlay.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: How many troops he see?

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WAGGONER
dialogues.text: Enough to spook the Colonel. Road march to the crossroads and secure them. Don’t stop for anything. Take my gas if you need it. Wardaddy looks at the map, makes some notes in a notebook

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Alright, sir. I’m on my way. Suddenly there is a loud WHISTLING of incoming German Artillery - Wardaddy, the Captain, the RADIOMEN and COMPA CLERKS hit the deck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of SOLDIERS plays blackjack on a blanket. Gamblin for piles of watches and jewelry. Norman and Gordo pourin gas into the Fury. BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-BOOM-KABOOM! - German artillery shells exp all around them. Bible drops into the turret, closes the hatch. Gordo slides off the tank and crawls underneath. Norman follows. Coon-Ass already there. A grinning fool.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: I was ticked off we were leaving. Don’t seem so bad now. Germans can flatten this town for all I care. BOOM! A large shell strikes Irma’s apartment building, collapsing the front. Then everything is obscured by dust smoke... WHAT THEY SEE - Though brief, the shelling has transforme the little village. Buildings burn. Others have collapses THE APARTMENT BUILDING is heavily damaged. A SOLDIER crawls along the street crying for his mama, hi legs are missing, just two stumps trailing blood. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Norman runs to the apartment building - At the smoking ru pile that was its facade moments before. He stops in his tracks and looks up... WHAT NORMAN SEES - Irma’s shattered body hanging from a splintered mass of wood floorboards... Next Norman SEES Emma is crushed and mixed into the rubbl She's gasping for her last breath... Norman shakes off the blow and starts to dig out Emma, desperate, frantic - Coon-Ass grabs him and drags him awa COON-ASS (CONT’D) You think you’re Jesus Christ? You gonna raise her up? She’s done. She is done. Norman starts throwing punches. Coon-Ass lets him vent, easily blocking them. COON-ASS (CONT’D) There you go. Get mad. Get mad.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What the fuck is wrong with you?! What the fuck is wrong with everyone? Nobody cares about anything. What the fuck is happening? Bored with being punched, Coon-Ass throws Norman to the ground. Kicks him in the ass.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: It’s called war. Quit your cussin’ and fightin’ and get your spindly ass in that tank, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four tank engines ROAR to life. Wardaddy does a quick check of the Fury’s tracks. Norman sits in the BOW seat. Tears streak his dusty face. Gordo looks at him. Sympathe

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Sorry about your lady friend. Norman ignores him. Here comes Sgt. Davis helping his ASSISTANT-DRIVER to his tank, he can barely walk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: He wounded?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Naw, drunk. Sgt. Davis pours the man into the front hatch and mounts tank. The Captain approaches Wardaddy.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN WAGGONER
dialogues.text: We'll hook up with you in the morning. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. He shakes the Captain’s hand. SCHWACK! A sniper’s bullet out the Captain’s throat, dropping him on the spot.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER VOICES
dialogues.text: Six is down! -- Sniper! -- They got the Old man! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy is up into the Fury like a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drops shut his hatch...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Move out! Let’s go! (into Radio) All tanks from One-Six. Sniper’s in those goddamn buildings on the right! Make ‘em go away. (to Bible) What are you waiting for? KABOOM! - The main gun fires. Coon-Ass slams home a fresh shell.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Clear! KABOOM! - Bible fires another. The Fury fires again and again... ON GORDO - Safe beneath his closed hatch, he sees Norman his head exposed - He grabs the kid and yanks him down... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Stupid. You wanna die? Norman glares at him. With a new hardness that takes Gord surprise. WARDADDY’S PERISCOPE POV - A row of four hundred year old buildings is destroyed in just over a minute. Their roofs be seen collapsing through clouds of thick dust and shattering explosions as the tanks pump high explosive sh into them. Into radio:

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: All tanks cease fire. If that didn’t get him nothing will. Let’s get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four tanks of lst Platoon Love Company pull out for t next mission. Wardaddy leads the way in the Fury. They are the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse - Leaving be a town transformed. Blood in the streets. Stacks of dead. Burning buildings. Piles of rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open flat farm country. The occasional farm building. The column of four tanks moves fast. Wardaddy keys the interc

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Norman. Get your ass up here. Norman looks at Wardaddy. Who waves for him to join him. Norman carefully climbs out of his hatch. And picks his w across the moving tank. Wardaddy pats the big .50 Cal mac gun.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why don’t you sit up here for a bit and run this baby. Norman grabs the spade grips and stands behind the turret His face is angry stone. Wardaddy seems relaxed. Almost enjoying the beautiful country. He looks at Norman.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know how you feel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: You have no idea how I feel.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Today... Look, what happened back there. Is every day. It’s every day.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Today's the worst day of my life.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Like I said, that’s every day. If you think it can’t get worse, it can. And it will. I started this war killing Germans in Africa. Then France. Then Belgium. Now I’m killing Germans in Germany. It will end. Soon too. But before it does a lot more people gotta die. Wardaddy points out a massive column of black smoke in th distance. It is the The herald of destruction on an unbelievable level. death of a city.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See that? That’s a whole city on fire. I get that’s where those bombers were heading. The dying ain’t done. The killing ain’t done. Norman tries to understand the enormity of what he is witnessing. He can’t. They ride in silence for a beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My mother was born near here. I think right there in that city burning to the ground. I got no problem killing my kin.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: How’d you get all burnt up?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: My back?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Germans did it? That why you hate them so much? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: No. I did it. Before the war. Before the Army. I had a beautiful girl I was gonna marry. Rose. She made me feel like a fucking king. Pretty like one of those old paintings. She was good. A good person. She had a good heart. Wardaddy looks at Norman. Not sure if he should continue. does...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I drank then. I’d get asshole drunk and Rose hated it. There was a dance in town. With a band from Wichita. I had her old man’s truck. My little brother came with us. He was sixteen. And looked just like you. With the same “I’m smarter than everyone else around me” expression you got. And he was. Book smart and people smart. A good kid. Well I drank two bottles of nickel whisky and got in a punch-up at the dance with this big Indian. K.O.ed him with a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I’m not your bartender and I’m not your pastor. You don’t need to tell me this.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: And I ain’t your friend. You’re listening ‘cause someone has to hear. The sheriff got called so I shoved Rose and my brother in the truck and drove off like my hair was on fire. Yep, like a real shithead. Pedal to the mat. Hit an ice patch and flipped it. I got thrown and ended up under it. The engine right on my back, cooked me like Sunday’s beef roast. Rose and my brother got their necks broken. Whole country hated me for it. I got the chain gang. I laid roadbeds. Worked cotton. Mule teams. War started and the Judge told me to dies for my country. Best advice I ever got. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Norman looks out on the German countryside. Then at Warda Despite his age, Norman has a strong, quiet wisdom.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Does it matter now? Does it matter here?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Does to me.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: You killed them.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I know what I did.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: You're already dead.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I don’t disagree. Been with these fine Gentlemen since nineteen forty two. And they don’t know none of this. Not a word of it. Keep it that way. Norman will keep his secret.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I was born in the caul.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Where’s that?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: A caul. A birth shroud around my head. So I see things. Sometimes I know things are going to happen. And people tell me things. Since I was little. Bad things. Confessions. I’m used to it. Don’t worry, you'll get your wish. When I said you were already dead it didn’t mean anything but what it means. You’re going in the ground soon. Wardaddy likes hearing that. He looks at Norman.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: You're a strange one, Norman. (then) My brother’s name was Norman. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Norman REACTS - Not to Wardaddy - But to the terribly thi corpses filling the ditches on either side of the road. T wear the infamous striped pajamas of the camp system. The were shot after collapsing during a forced march.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Why are they so thin?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: They're from the concentration camps. They starve ‘em to death there.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Are they criminals?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: No. They’re just people. Regular people. Germans are marching them around to keep them from us. Rather have them dead than free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A HUNDRED CIVILIANS dig a tank ditch through a couple farmer's fields. They stop working and stare in awe as Wardaddy’s four tanks race right past them on the unblock road. Wardaddy FIRES a magazine from his assault rifle into the air. Civilians hit the dirt or drop their shovels and run Wardaddy laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four tanks have stopped by a low hill. Wardaddy and S Davis are on their bellies at the top of the hill studyin the shallow valley below with binoculars. A couple miles away is the CROSSROADS the tanks are to protect. A few farm buildings dot the landscape. It is deceptively calm and bucolic.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: What are you thinking, Don?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: There’s the crossroads. We’ll set our picket line along that defiladed area to the right. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’1l be outpost tank by that little hill with the trees.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Sounds copacetic.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Let’s get in position before dark. German Army moves at night. I wanna be ready for ‘em. Let’s go. Wardaddy and Sgt. Davis crawl back towards their tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tanks head for the crossroads. Norman is back in the front right hatch. ON LOVE 1-5 - The last in the tank column -- THWACK-KABOOM! - Is suddenly hit by a high velocity gun.. It’s turret is blown into the air - The tank instantly bu a maelstrom of gasoline, explosives and gun propellant...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Fuck! Where the fuck did that come from? Driver! Reverse! (into Radio) All tanks, back up! Get behind the rise on the right. Everyone button up. The three remaining tanks quickly reverse and spread out. Wardaddy scanning with binoculars. Looking very worried.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: What the fuck was it?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: That was an 88. It’s a goddamned tank. FSSSSS-WHAM! - A glowing high-velocity shell hits the gro and ricochets in front of the Fury.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Tank! Three O'clock! Eight hundred yards! Wardaddy whips his binoculars to 3 o'clock... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: WHAT HE SEES - A GERMAN TIGER TANK near a barn in a hay field. Tigers are the deadliest tank of the war. Wardaddy three Shermans are hopelessly outgunned, worse, a Tiger’s armor is nearly impervious to their cannons.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I see it. It’s a goddamned Tiger. Bible, get an eyeball on him and send it.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: I got him! On the way! KABOOM! - The Fury fires. Its glowing shell strikes the f of the distant Tiger and ricochets off harmlessly.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Let’s get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Unless he drowns himself in a shit filled ditch, it’s up to us to kill him. C’mon, hit that sonofabitch! KABOOM-KABOOM-KABOOM! - All three tanks open fire on the Tiger...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All tanks! Fast right turn! Right at him. Let’s bumrush this cocksucker. Turn on your gyros! Shoot and scoot! The three tanks stop backing up - They quickly turn towar the Tiger and accelerate right at him! Firing their canno as fast as they can. Three little David's versus one Goliath - The Tiger aims Love 1-4, the middle tank... KABOOM! - The 88 cannon shell misses the Sherman - But hi Sgt. Peterson - Taking his head right off. KABOOM-KABOOM-KABOOM! - The Sherman’s keep firing. Quickl closing the distance to the massive German tank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tense faces. Bible focuses on the target. Coon-Ass stands with a fresh shell - Bible fires... KABOOM-KERCHANG-CLANK! - Coon-Ass loads the cannon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Clear -- KABOOM-KERCHANG-CLANK! - They keep pumping rounds into th massive German tank. ON NORMAN - Staring at the Tiger through his periscope. H opens fire... BRDDDDDDT - .30 Cal spits empty brass as it jackhammers s at the armored enemy monster. NORMAN'S PERISCOPE POV - His tracer rounds splash harmles against the German tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KAPOW! - The Tiger again fires at the middle tank... THWACK! - Its shell strikes the turret and goes right through. The fatally wounded Sherman rolls to a stop, gus yellow smoke. The DRIVER and A-DRIVER bail out... The Tiger opens fire with its machine gun - Splattering t two poor tankers...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Fucking animals! Load a white phosphorous. Blind the bastard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coon-Ass loads a phosphorous shell.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Clear! Bible, ever cool under fire, takes careful aim and toes t firing peddle - KABOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POW! The white phosphorous shell bursts with a large clou dense white smoke. Burning clumps of phosphorous cover th Tiger... The Fury and Sgt. Davis’ tank are damn close to the power Tiger. They are now passing down its right side... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Here we go. Shoot at the back third, under the track. AP. Fire when ready.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: I know where to hit him.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: So shoot the sumbitch! KABOOM! KTANG! -- The shot was high, it glances off the Tiger... The monster’s turret is turning toward the Fury... KABOOM! -- The Fury fires - KTANG! - Its round pierces th Tiger's gas tank. Black smoke erupts from its engine deck

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hit ‘em again! In the sweet spot. KABOOM! KTANG! Another money shot into the Tiger’s engine compartment. The big tank grinds to a stop. The fiver TIGER CREWMEN abandon their tank - They wear sinister black uniforms... The Fury charges the burning tank. Wardaddy shoulders his assault rifle - He’s about to light up the running German tankers when... BRDDDDDDDDDDDT! - The five Tiger Crewmen are shot to piec

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s Norman doing the shooting. He’s becoming a real motherfucker. He reloads his machine gun...

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: That’s it, kid. Fuck those Krauts.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: How'd that feel, Norm? Norman cocks his machine gun - KERCHACK!

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Like nothing. This time he means it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: IN THE TURRET - Bible wipes his face with a rag. Coon-Ass refills the ready rack with ammo...

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Where'd a Tiger come from? German army ain’t supposed to have no gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is low in the sky. Another bloody day is nearing conclusion. Wardaddy sits in the Fury’s turret. He lost t more tanks, now just burning wrecks. He watches the Tiger burn for a moment, his jaw grinding. Sgt. Davis’ tank pulls alongside the Fury. He’s scared/

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: Holy shit, Don. Binkowski and Peterson are gone. Florida Mike. Nicky Colletto. They got wives and kids. And Stan? Stan’s fucking dead. They’re all dead.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I know who’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: We have our job. Like we always do. I can’t have you all spooked. Can you shake it off?

dialogues.speaker: SGT. DAVIS
dialogues.text: I’m not like you, Don. Nobody is.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Check out the barn. Make sure there’s no Krauts in there. The barn is a hundred yards away. Sgt. Davis heads to it his tank, Love 1-3. He stops outside the barn doors. Wardaddy scans the area with his binoculars - Not a threa sight... Sgt. Davis’ ASSISTANT DRIVER gets out and pulls open the Barn’s big double doors... BRDDDDT! - He’s nearly cut in half with a long burst... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The ROAR of a starting tank engine as ANOTHER FUCKING TIG TANK emerges from the barn! BRDDDDDDDDT - The Tiger fires its coaxial machine gun, spattering Sgt. Davis across his turret. Its huge cannon lines up on Love 1-3 and fires... KABOOM! - The point blank cannon shot tears through the Sherman like butter. The ammunition inside EXPLODES. KA-WHAM! It is a violent and shattering detonation, the turret is thrown in the air, the side of the Sherman spli open like tin foil - Another tank dies... ON WARDADDY - He REACTS, gets low in the turret...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tank! Hit it! AP! Three rounds! Gordo! Get right on his ass. The Fury turns and lurches toward the big enemy tank... The Tiger accelerates out of the barn, colliding with the burning wreckage of Davis’s tank, shoving it aside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bible traverses the turret. It feels like it’s taking for to aim the main gun at the Tiger... Gordo double clutches and puts the Fury in 3rd gear. He stomps the gas pedal, white knuckling the steering levers KABOOM! - Bible fires. Missing the tank... GORDO’S PERISCOPE POV - The second Tiger is looming damn close - Its turret traversing to line up a shot on the Fury...

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Okay, here we go! You want me to hit him?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Don’t hit him, you dumbass! Make a tight turn around him! Drive around him and stay close as you can get! Just keep moving! Bible, keep hitting him! BOOM! - The Tiger fires... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KTANG! - It’s a glancing strike against the side of the F causes a burst of SPARKS inside. The noise and shock of t impact stun Gordo and Norman... HYDRAULIC OIL sprays everywhere... There is a SMOKING WHITE HOT DENT where the round struck hull. The Fury fills with smoke. Norman is bleeding from scalp...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I’m hit! I’m hit! Gordo ignores the chaos, keeps driving at the Tiger...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Gordo! Any damage?

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: I dunno. She still drives. Bible works the power traverse grip - Something’s wrong.. THE TURRET STOPS TURNING! - The shell damaged its mechani

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: I lost the power traverse! He switches to the MANUAL TRAVERSE WHEEL - Turning it frantically. The Fury’s turret now turning slower - This very bad... KABOOM! -- Bible fires again... BIBLE’S GUNSIGHT POV - The Armor Piercing shell bounces harmlessly off the Tiger’s turret...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s a close range tank duel - the two tanks are now just yards apart. Smoke from the burning Sherman’s washes over battle-locked armored vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: That’s it! Gordo, drive in a circle around him. We can move faster than he can swing his gun. ON THE TIGER - As its turret tries to catch up to the Fur The smaller, more agile American tank easily drives ina circle around the Tiger... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But the threatening of the Tiger’s cannon is starting to catch up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bible swinging the turret - Cranking the wheel as fast as can. Sweat pours off his face as he hunts for the soft sp in the Tiger’s armor. KABOOM! - Bible fires. The round just misses, plows into ground...

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: It’s not that easy. We’re moving too fast! Norman is scared shitless as he watches all this unfold through his periscope. He trades a worried, desperate loo with Gordo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy, only his head exposed, watches the Tiger. Inste of just driving in a straight line - The Tiger now turns toward the Fury - Its big cannon swinging faster... The Tiger is maneuvering to line up a shot and broadside American Tank. Smart bastards... With his tank damaged, Wardaddy knows he better make a mo or they are all going to die...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Gordo, when I say back up, you back up! Bible stand by! I’1l call the shot! Wardaddy waiting for just the moment - For the two moving tanks to align a certain way. The Tiger cannon is nearly in position to fire!

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gordo! Now! Reverse! Reverse! The Fury jolts to a stop - The same time as: KABOOM! - The Tiger fires... The cannon rips the sandbags off the front of the Fury, missing anything vital. The Fury is backing up... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Tiger realizes what is afoot - It starts turning in t other direction to protect its vulnerable engine compartm its huge tracks chewing up the earth...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bible! Steady. Steady. Steady... Wardaddy waiting for just the right moment. Excruciating tension as the two steel beasts dance around each other.. WARDADDY (CONT’D) Now! KABOOM! - The Fury’s cannon fires into the Tiger’s ass... The round rips through the engine and fuel tanks. There i fireball of burning gasoline...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coon-Ass feeds a fresh shell into the cannon breech...

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Clear! Bible stomps the foot pedal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KABOOM! - the round punches through the soft armor in the rear of the tank and penetrates the crew compartment... The ammunition insides EXPLODES. The Tiger shudders to a stop. The Driver's hatch opens -- Belching a column of fl The DRIVER tries to escape. But the flames are too intens He’s incinerated right before Wardaddy’s eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bible breathes a sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Tank destroyed. Wardaddy puts an arm around Bible... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Good shooting.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: I’m the instrument. Not the hand. God didn’t want us today. Norman sags in his seat, exhausted by the tension. Wardad drops inside the turret. Grabs the radio mic - Realizes t radios are trashed...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Radio’s are eighty-sixed. We’re on our lonesome until Baker Company shows up. Coon-Ass lights a smoke with shaking hands. Gordo wipes t grit from face with a sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: I quit. Fuck the Army. You can put me in the stockade. Take away my name and birthday. Find another driver.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Quit? Quit?! Boy, we get a dollar thirty five a day plus free chow and smokes. A goddamn paid European vacation. Best job I had. Coon-Ass wasn’t trying to be funny. He’s shaken to his co Wardaddy lets them vent. He passes Gordo a bottle of bran Gordo takes it and downs a long swig. Wardaddy SEES Norman sitting there quietly. Covered with hydraulic oil and blood. Staring into space.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Having a good time, kid? Norman looks at Wardaddy and shakes his head thinking “Wh the fuck is wrong with these people.” Wardaddy smiles. He knows Norman will be okay.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’re still open for business. Let’s head to the crossroads and keep ‘em out of Kraut hands like we've been told. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: With one busted-ass tank? In case you ain’t noticed, we're it. Platoon’s gone. The entire Platoon.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Are they? I’m sorry, I didn’t notice.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Don, you can be a real callous bastard sometimes.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: We got a job to do. We can sit here and bitch about it. Or we can go down to those crossroads and bitch about it there. I don’t see a hell of a lot of difference, do you?

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: That's real inspiring. Shit, now I wanna storm the gates of Hell and snatch Satan off his throne by his balls. Norman turns to Wardaddy and deadpans:

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: That’s not really true. He just said it to be an asshole. Norman just took the sarcasm to another level. The vetera tankers stare at Norman -- He is becoming one of them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is setting. The Fury moves up the road approachin the rural tree lined intersection with an OLD HOUSE and a BEER HALL - There isn’t a soul in sight. Wardaddy scans the terrain with his binoculars. He’s look for a good spot to park the Fury for the night. The tank moving through the intersection. BOOM! - The Fury runs over a mine - The explosion lifts t tank and drops it. The broken left track falls off the dr wheel...  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a damn hard whack -- Dust and smoke fill the inter Rations and ammunition spill from its racks. SPARKING electrical shorts.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Fuck! Another Tiger!

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Calm down. It’s a mine. We hit a mine is all. Gordo shakes it off. The engine stalls. He restarts it. P it in gear. Lets up the clutch. The tank starts turning i circle.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: We threw a track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy aiming his .50 Cal at the nearby buildings. Coon exits the turret. Examines the broken track and the smoki crater the mine made.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: She’s broke as fuck. Busted a shock too.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: You fix it?

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why not?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Norman! Get out here! Norman exits his hatch - He’s afraid to jump down to the road...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What about mines?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: They're for vehicles. You ain’t heavy enough to set one off. Go with Coon-Ass and check out those buildings. I’m covering you. Go on. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Norman looks at Coon-Ass, who shrugs. They approach the O House just up the road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! - Coon-Ass kicks the door. Norman joins him inside. Both men freeze... WHAT THEY SEE - The interior of the house is filled with mines. Big round anti-tank mines to be exact. Stacks of t It’s being used as a munitions depot. Coon-Ass slowly backs out of there...

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Don’t touch nothin’.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Not planning on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordo and Bible have started unbolting a section of track from Fury’s side. Coon-Ass shouts to Wardaddy:

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Whole thing’s full of mines. Good thing you didn’t shoot the shit out of it or we'd be drinking whiskey with Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Maybe I will anyway. I could use a drink. Keep going. What’s in the other house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHAM! Coon-Ass kicks the door. Enters with Norman. This place is disturbing in a different way. There is dri blood everywhere. Bandages. Medical supplies. Cut off blo uniforms and boots. Amputated limbs. Flesh. Organs. And a half-dozen DEAD GERMAN SOLDIERS who succumbed to battle wounds. This was a temporary field hospital.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: At least there ain’t no live Krauts to worry about. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It is beyond creepy in here...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Can we go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coon-Ass and Norman return to the Fury. Gordo uses a trac breaking tool to remove the damaged track links. Bible pr the road around them for more mines.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Naw, nothing.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Kid, head up by those trees. You go outpost guard. Norman nods and heads up the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman sits in the roadside ditch. He checks his greasegu It’s loaded. He sets it in his lap. He adds drink powder to his canteen. Shakes it. He opens can of crackers with his little GI can opener. He chews t hard crackers and washes them down with his canteen. He yawns widely. He’s physically and emotionally drained his first day as a US Army tanker. After being in a tank he feels so alone and exposed out h He HEARS something. Scared, he raises his ugly black weap It’s just an OWL in the trees. Norman relaxes. He can’t k his eyes open. His head falls toward his chest. His heavy eyelids close. And he falls asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER - Norman startles awake. Gasping for breath. Dreami he was shot. He checks himself for holes. And relaxes - I was just a dream... He berates himself for falling asleep. He gets on his kne To a less comfortable position. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Then he freezes. And his eyes grow wide. WHAT NORMAN SEES - Moving toward him along the dark road long column of silhouettes. GERMAN SOLDIERS - Marching toward him. A lot of them. Mor than he’s ever seen. There are several hundred. And there something about the way they move. Theses aren’t shufflin demoralized conscripts. These are health, well equipped combat troops - And they are heading his way... Norman thinks for a moment. He has to warn the others... He gets low and slowly backs down the ditch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordo, Coon-Ass and Bible work on repairing the track. Wardaddy sits in the turret, a deadly alert sentry with b machine gun. He can’t see the approaching men. Here comes Norman at a full run...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Why good evening, Norman. Why aren’t you at your post?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: They're coming.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Who's coming?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: The Germans

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: More than I can count. Wardaddy climbs down from the turret.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I’m sure it’s some bums looking for someone to surrender to. (to Coon-Ass) Keep working. I'll be right back. Wardaddy and Norman head up the road...  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy and Norman move low along the ditch. Wardaddy SE the approaching troops - Silhouettes in the darkness. He just hear their hobnailed boots CRUNCHING the road. He grabs Norman’s arm and drags him out of there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy and Norman come running.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: There’s a goddamned SS battalion headed this way.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Bullshit. Bible sees he’s dead serious...

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Marching this way. Wardaddy’s mind is racing - They face hopeless odds.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Let’s get out of here. They’1l never see us in the dark. Let ‘em pass through.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: We’re not running. We’re fighting it out. We'll hold this damn crossroad. His men look at him like he’s insane. This is unlike anyt they have ever done.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: You wanna sit here in a busted tank and hold off an SS battalion? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: No I don’t want to. But it’s what we're doing. Mount up. Take your fighting positions. Wardaddy climbs aboard the Fury. His jaw tenses. It’s oka with him. He double checks his .50 Cal.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go on. Get outta here. Norman looks at the other guys. Then at Wardaddy. He cros to the Fury and stands by it, looking at the others with crossed arms. With that show of bravery, Gordo, Coon-Ass and Bible have choice but to follow suit. The three men approach the Fur No one has any illusions - This somber, sober choice mean their deaths. Wardaddy smiles. As much of a smile as he can muster. The he’s all business.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’re gonna play dead, like we’ve done before. Let ‘em march right up. Then open up with all we got and splatter the assholes all over the road. (to Coon-Ass) Grab us one of them dead Krauts.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: We gonna have a pig roast?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Something like that. Coon-Ass rushes off toward the Old House... Wardaddy grabs his knife and cuts several packs and dufflebags off the tank. He hands Norman a gas can...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Give ‘em a good soaking. Norman pours the gas on them. Gordo grabs extra boxes of from the storage racks and shoves them into the tank. Bible is in the turret singing a hymn. He resets the fuze the cannon shells for close-in work. He wipes the main gu breech down. Cleans his optics. Oils the machine gun. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Here comes Coon-Ass dragging a body...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hurry up with that sack ‘a shit. Wardaddy jumps down to help. He tosses the body on the fr of the tank. Pulls off his jacket and puts it on the body

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Toss me that helmet. Norman tosses him an American helmet. Wardaddy straps it the corpse’s head. He grabs the gas can from Norman. Spla the body with it. Wardaddy lights a smoke with a match. T tosses the match on the body - FWOOMP! Wardaddy lights another match and tosses it on the packs the road - FWOOMP! Satisfied, he surveys his work.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now they ain’t gonna see nothing but a shot-out tank with a blown track. Get it. Button up. The men slip into the Fury and close the hatches. It look like a bigger shit pile than when we first saw it, bathed the firelight of the burning packs and the German corpse. Debris scattered around it, a broken track...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman lines up boxes of ammunition for his machine gun. wipes the gun with a rag. Gordo loads his submachine-gun. Stacks up extra magazines. He opens a case of grenades and removes their safety clip Pausing to swig from his bottle of brandy. Coon-Ass organ the main gun rounds.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: We got four rounds of cannister. Four Willy Petes. Twenty three Supercharges and thirty three solid shots.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Alright. Load cannister. Have the other three in your lap.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: What’s cannister? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Turns this cannon into a big fucking shotgun. Wardaddy pulls out a bottle of French Cognac. He opens it Stares at it like it’s the very gates of Hell. Bible is mortified Wardaddy is considering drinking it.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Might as well get a little tight. Won’t be around for the hangover.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Don. No.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Let the man have a taste. Wardaddy pours the booze in his mouth, it splashes down h cheeks. Norman watching him - If he didn’t know they were going to live through this he does now.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: God that’s better than good. Like warm honey dripping on my heart. He offers Bible the bottle. Bible takes it. He meditates the demon liquor a beat. Then:

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: I know you hate me preaching, but what we're doing is a righteous act. There’s a bible verse I think about sometimes. Then I heard the voice of the Lord saying, “Whom shall I send? And who will go for us?” And I said, “Here am I. Send me.” That resonated. Bible sees it on the faces of the men.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Book of Isaiah. Chapter six. Bible is floored Wardaddy knew that...

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Yeah, Don. That’s exactly right. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bible drinks from the bottle. Then hands it to Coon-Ass. takes a long pull. He passes it to Gordo. He takes a swig passes to Norman. Norman finishes the bottle.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Damn son, you’re a fighting, fucking, drinking machine.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Machine. That’s it. That’s your war name. I christen thee “Machine”.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO/BIBLE
dialogues.text: Machine! “Machine” - Norman like the nickname. He smiles. This now makes him a full fledged member of the Fury’s crew. Bible looking through the periscope - REACTS...

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: They're coming. The mood instantly switches to one of wary fear. The men their places behind their weapons. Wardaddy watches the e draw closer through his periscope.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: .+-Nobody does nothing until I say... WARDADDY'S PERISCOPE POV - The column of SS TROOPERS is close. Helmets, boots, weapons clearly visible. They look surprisingly modern in their camouflage uniforms. Norman SEES the SS TROOPERS marching closer. It’s agonizi to wait and do nothing. His finger ready on the trigger o his machine gun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fast marching SS Troopers quickly approach the Fury. Looking like nothing more than a disabled tank. An SS LIEUTENANT barks crisp orders.

dialogues.speaker: SS LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: (in German) Reinhold, take your men and clear those structures. Hoehner, ensure the enemy tank is unoccupied. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The SS TROOPERS split off and investigate the Old House a the BEER HALL. Ten more rush ahead of the march column to investigate the Fury. They approach the tank. Unconcerned Searching the various crates for rations and cigarettes l kids on Christmas morning. Two troopers climb aboard the tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew listens to the movement around the tank. The SCRAPING of metal hobnailed boots against the tank’s hull It is hateful to do nothing. Bible’s foot hovers above th firing button on the turret floor. Eyes glued to his periscope. Wardaddy waiting. Watching. A grenade in each hand. Coon- sweating bullets. Wondering why Wardaddy doesn’t give the order to shoot. Norman's face pressed against his scope. He licks his lip His mouth is bone dry. NORMAN'S PERISCOPE POV - He SEES a TROOPER reaching for h hatch... Norman aims his greasegun up at his hatch. Norman is scar shitless. His hatch opens revealing an astonished SS Trooper. Norman squeezes the trigger of his greasegun... BRDDDDDDDT! - Blowing the Trooper off the tank.

dialogues.speaker: SS LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: Alarm!

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Hit ‘em! Everything happens at once... The Troopers in the road dive for cover... Bible stomps the foot switch... KABOOM! - The main gun fires... Norman pulls the hatch shut - CLANG! - And opens up with machine gun... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Wardaddy pulls the pins of his grenades. He opens the “pi door” on the side of the turret. Drops the grenades outsi Slams the door shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Utter chaos - Cannon rounds tear into the column of men a EXPLODE - SS TROOPERS tumble like bowling pins... BRDDDDDDT! - Tracers from Fury’s two .30 Cal machine guns slice into SS Troopers as they scramble for cover. Mowing them down... BOOM-BOOMM! Wardaddy’s grenades explode. Blowing the two Troopers off the top of the tank... KABOOM! The main gun fires again. More Troopers are kille Several Troopers run into the buildings for shelter... SS OFFICERS and NCOs bark orders trying to create order f the madness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BRDDDDDDDT! - Norman jackhammers long bursts into running Troops. Bible fires the coax machine gun in long burst... The tank filling with smoke from the firing weapons. Norm reloads his machine gun. Wardaddy watching the Troopers scatter and run...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Keep squirting that coax! Traverse right! Steady... On! Fire! KABOOM! - Bible fires. The gun spits out the smoking bras shell. Coon-Ass shoves a fresh shell into the breech.

dialogues.speaker: COON-ASS
dialogues.text: Clear! BOOM! - Wardaddy watching where it hits...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Up fifteen! Right fifteen! Bible makes adjustments to the gun’s hand wheels... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bow gunner! Squirt those assholes running for the house. KABOOM! The gun fires. Norman shifts his fire...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay! Loader. Four rounds of Willy Pete up. Bible put ‘em in those buildings. Burn the fucking things to the ground, they’re full ‘a Krauts. Wardaddy’s periscope spins 360-degrees as he turns to continually check the rear of the tank. Bible works the h wheel and aims at the building.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: On the way! KABOOM! - He fires the Willy Pete shell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOOM! - The White Phosphorous shell hits the wood buildin and explodes with a spectacular burst of burning white ho streamers - It’s like the 4th of July. The tracers, the explosions, the fires. The SS Troopers returning fire. What wildly beautiful chaos. BOOM-BOOM-BOOM! - The Fury pumps three more phosphorous shells into the two buildings. The buildings start to bur Bathing the area with a warm orange glow... Burning SS Troopers run out of the buildings... BRDDDDDDT! - They’re cut down by the tank’s machine guns. The fire backlights the SS Troopers making them easier fo the Fury to spot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fury is filled with acrid blinding smoke from the spe gunpowder. Wardaddy watching the destruction...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: It’s a fucking turkey shoot. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He takes a swig from a fresh bottle and lights a cigarett his face shiny with sweat, his eyes burning with madness. The Coaxial machine gun is glowing RED HOT. So it Norman’ machine gun. Suddenly Norman's gun “RUNS AWAY” - Cooking off rounds by itself, zipping through a fresh ammo belt...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: My gun’s going crazy! Gordo twists the belt, stopping the runaway weapon...

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: It’s over heating! Don’t let it burn up. Gordo puts on an asbestos glove and changes the red hot barrel with a fresh one. Norman reloads and keeps firing. KABOOM! - Bible steadily firing the main gun... WARDADDY’S PERISCOPE POV - He SEES a cluster of SS Troops hiding in a ditch - They shoot at the Fury - THWACK! - A bullet strikes his periscope shattering it... Wardaddy yanks out the broken periscope. Slaps a new one its place. And continues his observation.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Traverse right. Steady. Steady. Right there. Hit ‘em! KABOOM! - Bible fires... WARDADDY'S PERISCOPE POV - BOOM! - The shell explodes in ditch launching several in the air. Then the coax machine gun jams - Red hot, hopelessly overheated. Wardaddy puts on asbestos gloves and wrestles it from its mount. He opens the turret’s pistol door and tosses the r hot machine gun outside... He grabs a fresh gun pilfered from another tank. Lock it place. Reloads it.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Slow it down. Don’t burn up the guns. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRDDDDDDDDT - The new coax gun starts firing. The floor o the turret is covered with spent brass.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay! Okay! No targets! Cease fire! If you don’t see ‘em, don’t shoot ‘em. Can’t spare the ammo on guesswork. All firing stops. A sudden deafening silence. Wardaddy turning his periscope looking for SS Troopers.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We can be damn sure they’re working their way behind us. Anyone see anything?

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: No nothing.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Me neither.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Nine O’clock! Bazooka! WARDADDY'S PERISCOPE POV - He whips the scope around and an SS Trooper aiming an anti-tank rocket at the tank!

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Traverse right! Traverse right! Cocksucker’s got a Panzerfaust! Bible turning the hand wheel as fast as he can. The turre steadily moving - Sweat pours off his face... The SS Trooper fires - FWOOSH! - The anti-tank rocket HIS right past Wardaddy’s periscope, just missing the target. NORMAN'S PERISCOPE POV - Norman sees a couple of running shadows... BRDDDDDDT! - He cuts them down. He’s in the zone. Hunting targets and hitting them... The turret lines up on the trees alongside the road. KABOOM-KABOOM-KABOOM! - Bible fires three cannon rounds i the darkness. It’s quiet again. Wardaddy looking for targets. He wipes stinging sweat from his eyes with his sleeve. Then... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FWOOSH-BOOM! - An anti-tank rocket explodes against the turret with a burst of red sparks... A jet of molten steel plasma penetrates - Passing right through Coon-Ass and into the recoil tube of the cannon.. The crew is stunned by the impact. Coon-Ass absorbed the brunt of the blast - A smoking baseball size hole burned through his torso. He’s dead. The recoil tube of the cannon leaks hydraulic fluid. Ther a small fire. Wardaddy grabs the extinguisher and puts out the fire. Th tank is filled with smoke and the stench of charred flesh Bible embraces his dead comrade...

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Oh, Grady. Oh dear God. Please dear God have mercy on this man’s soul.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: He’s gone. We gotta fight. Bible will. He’s furious. He mounts his seat - Then he realizes the main gun is damaged. Oil everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Recoil assembly's shot. We can’t fire the 75.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Stay on the 30. Keep knocking ‘em down. Bible reloads the coaxial machine gun.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Two boxes left. We need ammo. They listen to the bullets hitting the tank - It sounds l rain on tin... Wardaddy scans the area with the periscope. Doing a compl circle... WARDADDY’S PERISCOPE POV - He sees muzzle flashes all aro them. In the firelight of the burning buildings, shadows dance and twist. It’s like being stalked by an army of bl cats. Bible SEES them too and opens fire... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: BRDDDDDDDDT-BRDDDDDDDDT - He fires several long bursts to keep the German’s heads down...

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m almost out!

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Me too! I got two boxes left!

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Gordo, gimme one. Gordo passes up the 250 round ammo box. Wardaddy opens it gets the belt ready for Bible. Then Wardaddy grabs severa smoke grenades...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We got ammo outside. I’m gonna drop some smokes. Gordo, you pop your hatch and lay down some cover fire. Bible and Machine, rip off what you got left. Wardaddy throws open his hatch - Pulls the smoke grenade pins, tosses them in a ring around the tank...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay. I’m going! Hit it! Wardaddy climbs up out of his hatch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The smoke grenades gush torrents of dense yellow smoke. Gordo opens his hatch - Fires his Tommy-gun at anywhere h thinks a German is hiding... Next to him, the muzzle of Norman’s machine gun spits fir lead and tracers into the night... Wardaddy scrambles over the turning turret. To the rack o -30 Cal ammo boxes. Gordo firing and reloading his Tommy-gun... BRDDDDT! - Bible fires the last of his ammo. He climbs up through Wardaddy’s hatch and grabs the grips of the big . heavy machine gun and lets it rip... RAT-AT-AT-AT-AT-AT-AT! - He’s chopping down a row of tree where at cluster of SS Troopers fire at the Fury. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It is a scene of inexpressibly wicked beauty - The hot or light of the blazing buildings. Bright white and pink tra slash the air. Bullets spark against tank steel. Dead and dying SS Troops in a haze of psychedelic yellow smoke. Running shadows. The sharp bright FLASHES of German hand grenades. And the noise! GUNFIRE, SCREAMING, SHOUTING. At the centre of it all - Wardaddy pulls several boxes of ammo from the turret’s external racks and pitches them in the open hatch... He HEARS A SCREAM - A FANATICAL SS TROOPER emerges from t wall of yellow smoke - Charging and firing his MP40 machi gun... Wardaddy pulls the .45 From his shoulder holster... THWICK! - Wardaddy is hit in the arm. Wardaddy aims, fire back... BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM! Dropping the SS bastard. Wardaddy grabs Bible’s shoulder - Banging away with the .50 Cal - Shouts his ear...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Get in! Get inside! Bible dives through the hatch. With bullets hitting all around. Wardaddy climbs inside the Fury. Gordo empties his magazine - BRDDDDT! - Drops inside the tank. CLANGING the hatch shut behind him. The yellow smoke is clearing -- Several SS TROOPERS run P CAMERA...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bible reloads his coax gun. Wardaddy passes boxes of ammo Gordo as Norman loads a fresh belt into his gun. Wardaddy back at his periscope looking for targets.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: We got eight boxes of ammo. Four per gun. Make it last.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: You're hit. Wardaddy looks at his arm and shrugs. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: So are you. That’s when Bible realizes blood is running down his neck His scalp got nicked with a bullet. Gordo pulls the pin out of a grenade. Quickly opens his h and tosses it outside. Norman concentrates on his periscope, walking his tracers onto the darting shadows outside - Gordo sees something..

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Ten O'clock. Thirty yards. Squirt those guys. Norman fires off a long burst. The last of the belt. He cracks open another box and reloads.

dialogues.speaker: GORDO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hurry up. I think they want to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I think you’re right. How long can we keep this up?

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Not long. Wardaddy HEARS hobnail boots on top of the tank - He pull his .45 And opens his hatch. An SS TROOPER is right there! -- He kicks Wardaddy’s gun hand, the .45 Drops to the turret basket floor. Wardaddy reaches up and grabs the Trooper's legs, pulls him down i the tank. Wardaddy pulls his knife... The German soldier headbutts Wardaddy with his helmet, splitting his nose. Wardaddy is not thwarted. He stabs th man in the chest. Bible freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: Oh dear God!

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: It’s alright. It’s alright. I got him. Gimme a hand. Wardaddy and Bible hoist the dying German and shove him o of the tank through Wardaddy’s hatch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're getting cocky. Wardaddy is in pain. Blood soaking his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: You're not good leaking oil everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: So patch me up. Gordo, get up here and work the thirty. Gordo slips into the turret. Reloads the .30 Cal and star shooting targets. ON NORMAN - Still shooting. Empty brass is up to his ankl Bible cuts open Wardaddy’s sleeve. Pours sulfa powder on gunshot wound and bandages it. As Bible tends his wound..

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If a man loves the world, the love of the Father ain’t in him. For all in the world, lust of the flesh, lust of the eyes, the pride of life, is not of the Father. But of the world.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: The world and its desires pass away. But he who does God’s will lives forever. Off Bible’s quizzical look...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I once had a long spell with nothing but the good book and my conscience. With his arm patched up, Wardaddy recovers his .45 Pistol Bible turns to Gordo.

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: I got it. Gordo has a worried look...

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Brother it’s the last belt. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bible replaces Gordo at the gunner’s position. Wardaddy i mulling their options. Bible turning the turret. Firing t coax with its footswitch. ON NORMAN - As the last few rounds feed through his gun..

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I’m out! I need another can. BRDDDDT! CLICK! - That’s when Bible runs dry...

dialogues.speaker: BIBLE
dialogues.text: She’s done.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: That’s it then. There ain’t more. Worried looks are traded...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t shit your panties. We still got head weapons and the fifty. Wardaddy opens his hatch and climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Pass me a can of fifty. Bible hands up a box of ammo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wardaddy reloads the .50 Cal. He squints into the shadows SEE a MAN RUNNING and fires... RAT-AT-AT-AT-AT! - The man bursts like a water balloon. Bible opens the Gunner’s hatch and joins Wardaddy with hi Tommy-gun. Then Gordo and Norman open their hatches, submachine guns ready... It's deathly quiet. Just the crackling of the burning buildings. The moaning of the wounded Germans.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: ...Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: GORDO
dialogues.text: Everywhere. A GERMAN MACHINE GUN OPENS FIRE! - The big kind that soun like an evil chainsaw. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: It sprays bullets all over the Fury - Gordo pulls the pin a grenade, cocks his arm to throw it... THWACK! - Gordo is hit through the chest and drops the grenade inside the tank.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Grenade! Wardaddy swings the big .50 On the German MG... RAT-AT-AT-AT-AT-AT! - His tracers find the source of the German tracers. The German MG fire stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordo is fatally wounded and bleeding out - He fumbles fo the HISSING grenade. Norman stares at him from across the transmission. He’s fucked - The grenade will kill them both! Gordo smiles at Norman - Then with dying strength he hold the grenade tight to his chest... WHOOMP! - Gordo’s body absorbs the blast, saving Norman. ON NORMAN - He’s just sick. Terrified and horrified - And wildly grateful of Gordo’s final act. The crew is down to three men. And a couple hundred Ss Troopers still lurk outside in the dark...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Norman! Keep shooting, son! Norman grits his teeth. Loads a fresh man in his greasegu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman pops up and fires a long burst into the ditch alongside the tank... Bible’s Tommy-gun jams - He fights to clear the malfuncti No dice. He tosses away the weapon. He jumps down from the tank and grabs a German assault ri He pulls magazines from the pouches of dead Troopers. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A supposedly dead SS TROOPER jumps to his feet and rushes him! - Bible grabs the assault rifle by the barrel and sw with all his might... CRACK! - He catches the SS Trooper in the face with the buttstock - Teeth go flying. Bible flips the gun around a squeezes the trigger. BRDDDDT! - Finishing the job. Bible scrambles back to the Fury. Several German smoke grenades are tossed at the Fury. The gush dense white smoke - Smoke washes over the tank - Wardaddy, Norman and Bible can’t see a thing.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Get ready. They’re gonna make a move. Wardaddy pulls a pin on a grenade. His instincts tell him where to throw it... BOOM! - The grenade explodes - Followed by the SCREAMING the soldiers it maimed...

dialogues.speaker: SS VOICE
dialogues.text: (in German) You motherfuckers! We're going to skin you alive!

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: (in German) Your mother’s in here. She can’t talk now. Her mouth’s full.

dialogues.speaker: SS VOICE
dialogues.text: I'll cut off your fingertips and make you eat them!

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Shut up and send me more pigs to kill! Suddenly dozens of German weapons open up simultaneously. It is an unbelievable volume of fire. Wardaddy fires back blindly into the smoke... RAT-AT-AT-AT-AT-AT-AT-AT-AT! - He runs out of ammo...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bible! Ammo! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Bible drops into the turret and grabs a box of ammo off t rack. He climbs up and hands it to Wardaddy. THWACK! - Bible is hit in the head and instantly killed. clatters back into the tank. Now it’s just Norman and Wardaddy. ON NORMAN - Helplessly cowering for his life as bullets ricochet all around him... THWACK-THWACK! - Wardaddy is hit twice... WARDADDY (CONT’D) Button up! Wardaddy drops inside the tank and closes the hatch. Norm closes his hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullets striking the tank sound like gravel hitting s metal. Wardaddy holds Bible. He has a massive head wound. Wardaddy is devastated. He gently wipes the blood from Bible’s face.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
