dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Boyd. I did my best. Norman watching this - The SS Troopers are going to finis them off at any moment. Norman SEES Wardaddy is bleeding heavily from gunshot wounds...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: You’re wounded. Wardaddy notices his two new bullet holes for the first t

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Sure am.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Sergeant Collier?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: My name’s Don.

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. Don?

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Yeah kid? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I’m scared.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: I’m scared too. Wardaddy lights a cigarette. Finds his bottle of Cognac a takes a belt. Offers Norman the bottle, it’s covered with blood. Norman wipes the bottle. Takes a sip. Wardaddy is fading fast. Norman will soon be alone...

dialogues.speaker: NORMAN
dialogues.text: I want to surrender.

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY
dialogues.text: Please don’t. They’1ll hurt you real bad. And kill you real bad. Wardaddy takes a drag on his cigarette. The hatch above h is opening. With casual ease, Wardaddy pulls his .45 - Ai up at the hatch. BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM-BAM! - He empties the pistol the hatch drops shut. He ejects the mag. Moving slow from blood loss. The gun slick in his hands. He pats his pocke looking for a fresh mag... The hatch opens - THREE GRENADES ARE DROPPED INSIDE! Smoking, HISSING, deadly. Wardaddy looks at Norman who is frozen with fear...

dialogues.speaker: WARDADDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go. Norman snaps into action. He dives into the driver's seat pushing Gordo’s body aside - He opens the EMERGENCY ESCAP HATCH and dives through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman is under the tank. Without a weapon! BOOM-BOOM-BOOM! - The grenades explode inside the tank. W that Norman knows Wardaddy is no more. Norman is all alon Around him he hears angry cursing GERMAN VOICES... Norman crawls into the crater made by the land mine that broke the track. He makes himself as small as possible, p dirt in over himself. Burying himself...  109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SS Troopers everywhere. Their medics attend to their woun They swarm over the Fury. Open her hatches. Aim their wea inside and... BRDDDT-BRDDDDT! - Make sure all the occupants are dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YOUNG TROOPER looks beneath the tank with a flashlight. Norman, nearly entirely buried, follows the path of the l beam with his one exposed eye... The light plays across the undercarriage. Norman’s HEARTB feels excruciating loud. Blood pounding in his ears. An S OFFICER SHOUTS...

dialogues.speaker: SS OFFICER
dialogues.text: (in German) Let’s go! We’re behind schedule! Move it! Hurry up! Let’s move! The Young Trooper turns off the light. He stands and walk away. Iron boot heels crunching the road... Norman thanks his higher power. He may just survive this thing. Then the boots stop. And return... Norman tries to be one with the roadbed. The Trooper lays down - CLICK - Shines the light directly Norman’s face. He’s been discovered. ON THE YOUNG TROOPER - Now we see his face. He’s a kid, younger than Norman. A boy in uniform. He looks Norman in eye. Norman slowly lifts his hands in surrender. His oil and b soaked fingers emerging from the dirt and dust. The Young Trooper smiles weakly - “I won’t hurt you.” The turns off the light and walks away. Norman sags with anxious relief. Shrill WHISTLES. SHOUTING as the Sergeants get their squa on the march again. Jackboots CRUNCH the road as the SS formation continues down the road.  110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SS Troops are marching away in the distance. On a pointless and doomed mission against overwhelming Allied Armies steamrolling across Germany. Now it’s quiet. Dead quiet. Norman, buried in his hole, finally succumbs to exhaustion. His eyes close. He passes curled in his womb of dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Distant ROOSTERS CROW. The escape hatch slowly opens. It’ Norman - He slips inside the Fury. He forces his way past Gordo’s body. Then covers Gordo with a jacket. He moves t Coon-Ass and covers him. Then Bible, he gently crosses hi arms over his chest. There’s Wardaddy. Sitting there. The grenades have made a mess of him. Norman takes off his jacket and covers him u He pauses. Gently picks up Wardaddy’s big calloused hand. looks at his palm. Traces the line a moment. As if to con something he already knew. Then he sets it down. Norman finds Wardaddy’s knife on the floor of the turret basket. He picks up the knife and runs his thumb along al the notches. Norman HEARS something. Movement outside the tank. And VOICES! He freezes. Unsure what to do. This kid is traumatized, h in no condition to fight Nazis... Alone and scared. Norman sits there trembling, holding Wardaddy’s knife for protection... The hatch opens - It’s a SOLDIER... An American Soldier - One we recognize - The Huge Dirty Soldier from Baker Company - He looks at Norman with war weary eyes. Wipes his nose on his sleeve and shouts to hi buddies.

dialogues.speaker: HUGE DIRTY SOLDIER
dialogues.text: One’s alive!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fury is shot to hell, burnt and scarred. Baker Compan soldiers are gathered around her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Norman is pulled out of the hatch and laid onto a stretch Two MEDICS carry Norman to a waiting Half-Track.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: You're a hero. You know that? Norman doesn’t know what that means. Or really care. It i clear from the churning angst in his eyes he will never, be the same. CRANE UP - Until we look straight down on the crossroads see the true scope of the fight, of the carnage... Laid out in a ring around the tank for fifty yards are a couple hundred dead SS Troopers... Norman is loaded into the Half-Track. It slowly drives aw
